name: Michael
line: All right Jim. Your quarterlies look very good. How are things at the library?

name: Jim
line: Oh, I told you. I couldn't close it. So...

name: Michael
line: So you've come to the master for guidance? Is this what you're saying, grasshopper?

name: Jim
line: Actually, you called me in here, but yeah.

name: Michael
line: All right. Well, let me show you how it's done.

name: Michael
line: Yes, I'd like to speak to your office manager, please. Yes, hello. This is Michael Scott. I am the Regional Manager of Dunder Mifflin Paper Products. Just wanted to talk to you manager-a-manger. All right. Done deal. Thank you very much, sir. You're a gentleman and a scholar. Oh, I'm sorry. OK. I'm sorry. My mistake. That was a woman I was talking to, so... She had a very low voice. Probably a smoker, so... So that's the way it's done.

name: Michael
line: I've, uh, I've been at Dunder Mifflin for 12 years, the last four as Regional Manager. If you want to come through here... See we have the entire floor. So this is my kingdom, as far as the eye can see. This is our receptionist, Pam. Pam! Pam-Pam! Pam Beesly. Pam has been with us for... forever. Right, Pam?

name: Pam
line: Well. I don't know.

name: Michael
line: If you think she's cute now, you should have seen her a couple of years ago.

name: Pam
line: What?

name: Michael
line: Any messages?

name: Pam
line: Uh, yeah. Just a fax.

name: Michael
line: Oh! Pam, this is from Corporate. How many times have I told you? There's a special filing cabinet for things from corporate.

name: Pam
line: You haven't told me.

name: Michael
line: It's called the wastepaper basket! Look at that! Look at that face.

name: Michael
line: People say I am the best boss. They go, "God we've never worked in a place like this before. You're hilarious." "And you get the best out of us." I think that pretty much sums it up. I found it at Spencer Gifts.

name: Dwight
line: Shall I play for you? Pa rum pump um pum I have no gifts for you. Pa rum pump um pum

name: Jim
line: My job is to speak to clients on the phone about... uh, quantities and type of copier paper. You know, whether we can supply it to them. Whether they can pay for it. And... I'm boring myself just talking about this.

name: Michael
line: Whassup!

name: Jim
line: Whassup! I still love that after seven years.

name: Michael
line: Whassup!

name: Dwight
line: Whassup!

name: Michael
line: Whass...up!

name: Dwight
line: Whassup.

name: Michael
line: What?

name: Jim
line: Nothing.

name: Michael
line: OK. All right. See you later.

name: Jim
line: All right. Take care.

name: Michael
line: Back to work.

name: Jan
line: Just before lunch. That would be great.

name: Michael
line: Corporate really doesn't really interfere with me at all. Jan Levinson Gould. Jan, hello. I call her Hillary Rodham Clinton. Right? Not to her face, because... well, not because I'm scared of her. Because I'm not. But, um... Yeah.

name: Jan
line: Alright, was there anything you wanted to add to the agenda?

name: Michael
line: Um... Me no get an agenda.

name: Jan
line: What? I'm sorry?

name: Michael
line: I didn't get any agenda.

name: Jan
line: Well, I faxed one over to you this morning.

name: Michael
line: Really? I didn't... Did we get a fax this morning?

name: Pam
line: Uh, yeah, the one...

name: Michael
line: Why isn't it in my hand? A company runs on efficiency of communication, right? So what's the problem, Pam? Why didn't I get it?

name: Pam
line: You put in the garbage can that was a special filing cabinet.

name: Michael
line: Yeah, that was a joke. That was a joke that was actually my brother's, and... It was supposed to be with bills and it doesn't work great with faxes.

name: Jan
line: Do you want to look at mine?

name: Michael
line: Yeah, yeah. Lovely. Thank you.

name: Jan
line: OK. Since the last meeting, Ellen and the board have decided we can't justify a Scranton branch and a Stamford branch.

name: Michael
line: OK...

name: Jan
line: Michael, don't panic.

name: Michael
line: No, no, no, no, this is good. This is good. This is fine. Excellent.

name: Jan
line: No, no, no, Michael, listen OK. Don't panic. We haven't made... We haven't decided.

name: Michael
line: All the alarm bells are kind of going... ringie-dingie-ding!

name: Jan
line: I've spoken to Josh in Stamford. I've told him the same as you and it's up to either him or you to convince me that your branch can incorporate the other.

name: Michael
line: OK. No problem.

name: Jan
line: This does, however, mean that there is going to be downsizing.

name: Michael
line: Me no wanna hear that, Jan. Because downsizing is a bitch. It is a real bitch. And I wouldn't wish that on Josh's men. I certainly wouldn't wish it on my men. Or women, present company excluded. Sorry. Uh, is Josh concerned about downsizing himself? Not downsizing himself but is he concerned about downsizing?

name: Michael
line: Question. How long do we have to... Oh uh, Todd Packer, terrific rep. Do you mind if I take it?

name: Jan
line: Go ahead.

name: Michel
line: Packman.

name: Todd Packer
line: Hey, you big queen.

name: Michael
line: Oh, that's not appropriate.

name: Todd Packer
line: Hey, is old Godzillary coming in today?

name: Michael
line: Uh, I don't know what you mean.

name: Todd Packer
line: I've been meaning to ask her one question. Does the carpet match the drapes?

name: Michael
line: Oh, my God! Oh! That's... horrifying. Horrible. Horrible person.

name: Jan
line: So do you think we could keep a lid on this for now? I don't want to worry people unnecessarily.

name: Michael
line: No, absolutely. Under this regime, it will not leave this office. Like that.

name: Phyllis
line: So what does downsizing actually mean?

name: Stanley
line: Well...

name: Oscar
line: You guys better update your resumes just like I'm doing.

name: Angela
line: I bet it's gonna be me. Probably gonna be me.

name: Kevin
line: Yeah, it'll be you.

name: Pam
line: I have an important question for you.

name: Jim
line: Yes?

name: Pam
line: Are you going to Angela's cat party on Sunday?

name: Jim
line: Yeah, stop. That is ridiculous.

name: Michael
line: Am I going to tell them? No, I am not going to tell them. I don't see the point of that. As a doctor, you would not tell a patient if they had cancer.

name: Michael
line: Hey.

name: Ryan
line: Hey.

name: Pam
line: This is Mr. Scott.

name: Michael
line: Guilty! Guilty as charged!

name: Ryan
line: Ryan Howard from the temp agency. Daniqua sent me down to start today.

name: Michael
line: Howard, like Moe Howard. Three Stooges.

name: Ryan
line: Yup.

name: Michael
line: Watch this. This is Moe. Nyuck-nyuck-nyuck-nyuck-nyuck. Mee! Ah, right here. Three Stooges. Oh, Pam. It's a guy thing, Pam. I'm sort of a student of comedy. Watch this. Here we go. I'm Hitler. Adolf Hitler.

name: Pam
line: I don't think it would be the worst thing if they let me go because then I might... I don't think it's many little girls' dream to be a receptionist. I like to do illustrations. Um... Mostly watercolor. A few oil pencil. Um, Jim thinks they're good.

name: Pam
line: Dunder Mifflin. This is Pam.

name: Jim
line: Sure. Mr. Davis, let me call you right back. Yeah, something just came up. Two minutes. Thank you very much. Dwight, what are you doing?

name: Dwight
line: What?

name: Jim
line: What are you doing?

name: Dwight
line: Just clearing my desk. I can't concentrate.

name: Jim
line: It's not on your desk.

name: Dwight
line: It's overlapping. It's all spilling over the edge. One word, two syllables. Demarcation.

name: Dwight
line: You can't do that.

name: Jim
line: Why not?

name: Dwight
line: Safety violation. I could fall and pierce an organ.

name: Jim
line: We'll see. This is why the whole downsizing thing just doesn't bother me.

name: Dwight
line: Downsizing?

name: Dwight
line: Downsizing? I have no problem with that. I have been recommending downsizing since I first got here. I even brought it up in my interview. I say, bring it on.

name: Pam
line: You just still have these messages from yesterday.

name: Michael
line: Relax. Everything's under control. Uh, yeah. Yeah. That's important. Right. Oh this is so important, I should run to answer it.

name: Pam
line: What?

name: Michael
line: Come on. Six-Million Dollar Man! Steve Austin! Actually, that would be a good salary for me, don't you think? Six million dollars? Memo to Jan. I deserve a raise.

name: Pam
line: Don't we all?

name: Michael
line: I'm sorry?

name: Pam
line: Nothing.

name: Michael
line: If you're unhappy with your compensation, maybe you should take it up with HR. OK. Not today, OK? Pam, just be professional.

name: Michael
line: I think I'm a role model here. I think I garner people's respect. Attention all Dunder Mifflin employees, please. We have a meeting in the conference room, ASAP.

name: Michael
line: People I respect, heroes of mine, would be Bob Hope... Abraham Lincoln, definitely. Bono. And probably God would be the fourth one. And I just think all those people really helped the world in so many ways that it's really beyond words. It's really incalculable.

name: Michael
line: Now I know there's some rumors out there and I just kind of want to set the record straight.

name: Dwight
line: I'm Assistant Regional Manager. I should know first.

name: Michael
line: Assistant to the Regional Manager.

name: Dwight
line: OK, um, can you just tell me please? Just tell me quietly. Can you whisper it in my ear?

name: Michael
line: I'm about to tell everybody. I'm just about to tell everybody.

name: Oscar
line: Can't you just tell us.

name: Dwight
line: Please, OK? Do you want me to tell 'em?

name: Michael
line: You don't know what it is.

name: Dwight
line: OK. You tell 'em. With my permission. Permission granted.

name: Michael
line: I don't need your permission.

name: Dwight
line: Go ahead.

name: Michael
line: Corporate has deemed it appropriate to enforce an ultimatum upon me. And Jan is thinking about downsizing either the Stamford branch or this branch.

name: Ryan
line: I heard they might be closing this branch down. That's just the rumor going around. This is my first day. I don't really know.

name: Oscar
line: Yeah but Michael, what if they downsize here?

name: Michael
line: Not gonna happen.

name: Stanley
line: It could be out of your hands Michael.

name: Michael
line: It won't be out of my hands Stanley, OK. I promise you that.

name: Stanley
line: Can you promise that?

name: Dwight
line: On his mother's grave.

name: Michael
line: No.

name: Phyllis
line: What?

name: Michael
line: Well, yeah, it is a promise. And frankly, I'm a little insulted that you have to keep asking about it.

name: Stanley
line: It's just that we need to know.

name: Michael
line: I know. Hold on a second. I think Pam wanted to say something. Pam, you had a look that you wanted to ask a question just then.

name: Pam
line: I was in the meeting with Jan and she did say that it could be this branch that gets the axe.

name: Man
line: Are you sure about that?

name: Michael
line: Well, Pam maybe you should stick to the ongoing confidentiality agreement of meetings.

name: Dwight
line: Pam, information is power.

name: Stanley
line: You can't say for sure whether it'll be us or them, can you?

name: Michael
line: No, Stanley. No, you did not see me in there with her. I said if Corporate wants to come in here and interfere, then they're gonna have to go through me. Right? You can go mess with Josh's people, but I'm the head of this family, and you ain't gonna be messing with my chillin.

name: Jim
line: If I left, what would I do with all this useless information in my head? You know? Tonnage price of manila folders? Um, Pam's favorite flavor of yogurt, which is mixed berry.

name: Pam
line: Jim said mixed berries? Well, yeah, he's on to me. Um...

name: Michael
line: Watch out for this guy. Dwight Schrute in the building. This is Ryan, the new temp.

name: Ryan
line: What's up? Nice to meet you.

name: Michael
line: Introduce yourself. Be polite.

name: Dwight
line: Dwight Schrute, Assistant Regional Manager.

name: Michael
line: Assistant to the Regional Manager. So, uh, Dwight tell him about the kung fu and the car and everything.

name: Dwight
line: Uh... yeah I got a '78 280Z. Bought it for $1,200. Fixed it up. It's now worth three grand.

name: Michael
line: That's his profit.

name: Dwight
line: New engine, new suspension, I got a respray. I've got some photos.

name: Dwight
line: Damn it! Jim!

name: Michael
line: OK. Hold on, hold on. The judge is in session. What is the problem here?

name: Dwight
line: He put my stuff in Jell-O again.

name: Dwight
line: That's real professional thanks. That's the third time and it wasn't funny the first two times either Jim.

name: Dwight
line: It's OK here, but people sometimes take advantage because it's so relaxed. I'm a volunteer Sheriff's Deputy on the weekends. And you cannot screw around there. That's sort of one of the rules.

name: Michael
line: What is that?

name: Dwight
line: That is my stapler.

name: Michael
line: No, no, no. Do not take it out. You have to eat it out of there, because there are starving people in the world which I hate, and it is a waste of that kind of food.

name: Dwight
line: OK you know what, you can be a witness. Can you reprimand him?

name: Jim
line: How do you know it was me?

name: Dwight
line: It's always you. Are you going to discipline him or not?

name: Michael
line: Discipline. Kinky! All right, here's the deal you guys. The thing about a practical joke is you have to know when to start and as well as when to stop.

name: Dwight
line: Yeah.

name: Michael
line: And yeah, Jim this is the time to stop putting Dwight's personal effects into Jell-O.

name: Jim
line: OK. Dwight, I'm sorry, because I have always been your biggest flan.

name: Michael
line: Nice. That's the way it is around here. It just kind of goes round and round.

name: Ryan
line: You should've put him in custardy.

name: Michael
line: Hey! Yes! New guy! He scores.

name: Dwight
line: OK, that's great. I guess what I'm most concerned with is damage to company property. That's all.

name: Michael
line: Pudding. Pudding... I'm trying to think of another dessert to do.

name: Jim
line: Do you like going out at the end of the week for a drink?

name: Pam
line: Yeah.

name: Jim
line: That's why we're all going out. So we can have an end-of-the-week-drink.

name: Pam
line: So when are we going out?

name: Jim
line: Tonight, hopefully.

name: Pam
line: OK. Yeah.

name: Roy
line: Hey, man.

name: Jim
line: What's going on?

name: Roy
line: Hey, baby.

name: Pam
line: Hey.

name: Pam
line: Roy's my fiance. We've been engaged about three years. We were supposed to get married in September but I think we're gonna get married in the spring.

name: Pam
line: Do you mind if I go out for a drink with these guys?

name: Roy
line: No, no. Come on. Let's get out of here and go home.

name: Pam
line: OK. I'm gonna be a few minutes. So it's only twenty past five. I still have to do my faxes.

name: Jim
line: You know what? You should come with us. Because you know we're all going out and it could be a good chance for you to see what people are like outside the office. I think it could be fun.

name: Roy
line: It sounds good. Seriously, we've gotta get going.

name: Jim
line: Yeah, yeah.

name: Jim
line: Um... What's in the bag?

name: Roy
line: Just tell her I'll talk to her later.

name: Jim
line: No, definitely. All right, dude. Awesome. Will do.

name: Jim
line: Do I think I'll be invited to the wedding?

name: Michael
line: So have you felt the vibe yet? We work hard, we play hard. Sometimes we play hard when we should be working hard. Right? I guess the atmosphere that I've created here is that I'm a friend first, and a boss second... and probably an entertainer third. Just a second. Right? Oh, hey do you like The Jamie Kennedy Experiment? Punk'd and all that kind of stuff?

name: Ryan
line: Yeah.

name: Michael
line: You are gonna be my accomplice. Just go along with it, OK?

name: Ryan
line: All right.

name: Michael
line: Just follow my lead. Don't pimp me, all right? Come in. So, uh, Corporate just said that I don't want to...

name: Pam
line: You got a fax.

name: Michael
line: Oh, thank you. Pam, can you come in here for a sec. Just have a seat. I was gonna call you in anyway. You know Ryan. As you know, there is going to be downsizing. And you have made my life so much easier in that I am going to have to let you go first.

name: Pam
line: What? Why?

name: Michael
line: Why? Well, theft and stealing.

name: Pam
line: Stealing? What am I supposed to have stolen?

name: Michael
line: Post-it Notes.

name: Pam
line: Post-it Notes? What are those worth, 50 cents?

name: Michael
line: 50 cents, yeah. If you steal a thousand Post-It Notes at 50 cents apiece, and you know, you've made a profit... margin. You're gonna run us out of business, Pam.

name: Pam
line: Are you serious?

name: Michael
line: Yeah. I am.

name: Pam
line: I can't believe this. I mean I have never even stolen as much as a paperclip and you're firing me.

name: Michael
line: But the best thing about it is that we're not going to have to give you any severance pay. Because that is gross misconduct and... Just clean out your desk. I'm sorry.

name: Michael
line: You been X'd punk! Surprise! It's a joke. We were joking around. See? OK. He was in on it. He was my accomplice. And it was kind of a morale booster thing. And we were showing the new guy around, giving him the feel of the place. So you... God, we totally got you.

name: Pam
line: You're a jerk.

name: Michael
line: I don't know about that.

name: Michael
line: What is the most important thing for a company? Is it the cash flow? Is it the inventory? Nuh-uh. It's the people. The people. My proudest moment here was not when I increased profits by 17% or when I cut expenses without losing a single employee. No, no, no, no, no. It was a young Guatemalan guy. First job in the country, barely spoke English. He came to me, and said, "Mr. Scott, would you be the godfather of my child?" Wow. Wow. Didn't work out in the end. We had to let him go. He sucked.

name: Pam
line: Hey.

name: Jim
line: Hey.

name: Jim
line: How are things?

name: Pam
line: Good. I thought you were going out for a drink with...

name: Jim
line: Oh no, I just decided not to. How's your headache?

name: Pam
line: It's better, thanks.

name: Jim
line: Good. Good.

name: Pam
line: Yeah.

name: Jim
line: That's great

name: Jim
line: Yeah?

name: Pam
line: Um... Are you...

name: Jim
line: Am I walking out?

name: Pam
line: Yes.

name: Jim
line: Yes, I... Do you want to...

name: Pam
line: Yeah.

name: Jim
line: Great. Let me just...

name: Jim
line: Oh, Roy.

name: Pam
line: Yeah. Listen, have a nice weekend.

name: Jim
line: Yeah, definitely. You too. Enjoy it. You know what, just come here.

name: Michael
line: Hey, uh, can I help you out in here?

name: Mr. Brown
line: Oh, I'm all set, thanks.

name: Michael
line: Gotcha. Good. I'd go with the rows. That's a good idea.

name: Michael
line: Today is diversity day and someone's going to come in and talk to us about diversity. It's something that I've been pushing, that I've been wanting to push, for a long time and Corporate mandated it. And I never actually talked to Corporate about it. They kind of beat me to the punch, the bastards. But I was going to. And I think it's very important that we have this. I'm very, very excited.

name: Jim
line: That's the thing. It's very sturdy paper and on the back it says, "100% post-consumer content." What? Hello? Uh-huh. Wait. What? I'm sorry, Mr. Decker. I think I'm losing you. Hello? Hello? Yeah. Hold on one second. I don't know. Hold on one second.

name: Jim
line: Do you really have to do that right now?

name: Dwight
line: Yes I do. I should have done it weeks ago actually.

name: Jim
line: Mr. Decker, I'm sorry about that. What were you... Can you hold on one second? Yeah, just one second. Thanks. Hello? That's it. Perfect. So what I was saying... Hello? Thanks, Dwight.

name: Dwight
line: Retaliation. Tit for tit.

name: Jim
line: That is not the expression.

name: Dwight
line: Well, it should be.

name: Jim
line: This is my biggest sale of the year. They love me over there for some reason. I'm not really sure why but I make one call over there every year, just to renew their account, and that one call ends up being 25% of my commission for the whole year, so I buy a mini bottle of champagne, celebrate a little. And this year I'm pushing recycled paper on them for one percent more. I know. I'm getting cocky. Right?

name: Jim
line: Solitaire?

name: Pam
line: Yeah, Freecell.

name: Jim
line: Six on seven.

name: Pam
line: I know. I saw that.

name: Jim
line: So then, why didn't you do it?

name: Pam
line: I'm saving that 'cause I like it when the cards go T-ts-ts-tch-tch-tch.

name: Jim
line: Who doesn't love that?

name: Michael
line: Hey, Oscar! How are you doing, man?

name: Oscar
line: All right.

name: Michael
line: Did you have a good weekend going there?

name: Oscar
line: It was fine.

name: Michael
line: Oh yeah, I bet it was fun. Oh, hey! This is Oscar---

name: Oscar
line: Martinez.

name: Michael
line: Right. See? I don't even know, first-name basis!

name: Mr. Brown
line: Great. We're all set.

name: Michael
line: Oh hey, well, diversity, everybody, let's do it. Oscar works in... here. Jim, could you wrap it up, please?

name: Jim
line: Yeah, uh, Mr. Decker, please.

name: Michael
line: It's diversity day, Jim. I wish every day was diversity day.

name: Jim
line: You know what? I'm actually going to have to call you back. Thank you. Sorry about that.

name: Mr. Brown
line: Thank you. Thank you. Thank you. Great.

name: Michael
line: Come on people, let's get 'em in. Get in the cards! Get in the cards!

name: Mr. Brown
line: Thank you. Thank you very much. OK. Thanks for filling these out and I promise this'll be quick. At Diversity Today, our philosophy is about honesty and positive expectations. We believe that 99% of the problems in the workplace arise simply out of ignorance.

name: Michael
line: You know what? This is a color-free-zone here. Stanley, I don't look at you as another race.

name: Mr. Brown
line: Uh, see this is what I'm talking about. We don't have to pretend we're color-blind.

name: Michael
line: Exactly, were not...

name: Mr. Brown
line: That's fighting ignorance with more ignorance.

name: Michael
line: With tolerance.

name: Mr. Brown
line: No. With more ignorance.

name: Michael
line: Ignorance.

name: Mr. Brown
line: Right. Exactly. Uh, instead, we need to celebrate our diversity.

name: Michael
line: Let's celebrate.

name: Mr. Brown
line: Right. OK.

name: Michael
line: Celebrate good times. Come on! Let's celebrate diversity. Right?

name: Mr. Brown
line: Yes, exactly. Now here's what we're going to do. I've noticed that...

name: Michael
line: You know what? Here's what we're going to do. Why don't we go around and everybody... everybody say a race that you are attracted to sexually. I will go last. Go.

name: Dwight
line: I have two. White and Indian.

name: Mr. Brown
line: Actually, I'd prefer not to start that way. Michael, I would love to have your permission to run this session. Can I have your permission?

name: Michael
line: Yes.

name: Mr. Brown
line: Thank you very much. And it would also help me if you were seated.

name: Michael
line: OK.

name: Mr. Brown
line: Thank you. OK. Now, at the start of the session, I had you all write down an incident that you found offensive in the workplace. Now, what I'm going to do is choose one and we're going to act it out.

name: Dwight
line: A few of the ground rules?

name: Michael
line: Hey, hey why don't you run it by me and I'll run it by him.

name: Dwight
line: OK, can we steer away from gay people?

name: Mr. Brown
line: Um...

name: Dwight
line: I'm sorry. It's an orientation. It's not a race. Plus a lot of other races are intolerant of gays, so...paradox.

name: Mr. Brown
line: Well, we only have an hour.

name: Dwight
line: I figured it would save time.

name: Michael
line: OK. Why don't we just defer to Mr...

name: Mr. Brown
line: Mr. Brown.

name: Michael
line: Ah. Oh, right! OK. First test. I will not call you that.

name: Mr. Brown
line: Well, it's my name. It's not a test. OK? Um, so looking through the cards, I've noticed that many of you wrote down the same incident, which is ironic, because it's the exact incident I was brought in here to respond to. Now, how many of you are familiar with the Chris Rock routine? Very good. OK.

name: Michael
line: How come Chris Rock can do a routine and everybody finds it hilarious and ground-breaking and then I go and do the exact same routine, same comedic timing, and people file a complaint to Corporate? Is it because I'm white and Chris is black?

name: Mr. Brown
line: So we're going to reenact this with a more positive outcome.

name: Michael
line: I will play the Chris Rock guy. I would like to see someone else pull this off.

name: Mr. Brown
line: Well, let's have someone who wasn't involved in the reenactment.

name: Michael
line: OK, I will play guy listening.

name: Mr. Brown
line: Great. Guy listening. Ok, anyone else remember?

name: Kevin
line: I remember.

name: Mr. Brown
line: Great. You're the Chris Rock guy and you're guy listening.

name: Michael
line: OK.

name: Michael
line: Kevin is a great guy. He's a great accountant. He is not much of an entertainer.

name: Kevin
line: Basically, there are two types of black people and black people are actually more racist because they hate the other type of black people. Every time the one type wants to have a good time, then the other type comes in and makes a real mess.

name: Michael
line: OK. I'm sorry. I'm sorry. He's ruin... He's butchering it. Could you just let me... Every time... Every time black people want to have a good time, some ignant ass... I take care of my kid!

name: Mr. Brown
line: Wait a second.

name: Michael
line: They always want credit for something they supPOSED to do!

name: Mr. Brown
line: Stop it!

name: Michael
line: What you want a cookie?

name: Mr. Brown
line: Now, this is a simple acronym. HERO. Uh, at Diversity Today, we believe it is very easy to be a HERO. All you need are honesty, empathy, respect and open-mindedness.

name: Dwight
line: Excuse me, I'm sorry, but that's not all it takes to be a hero.

name: Mr. Brown
line: Oh, great. Well, what is a hero to you?

name: Dwight
line: A hero kills people, people that wish him harm.

name: Mr. Brown
line: OK.

name: Dwight
line: A hero is part-human and part-supernatural. A hero is born out of a childhood trauma, or out of a disaster that must be avenged.

name: Mr. Brown
line: Ok, you're thinking of a superhero.

name: Dwight
line: We all have a hero in our heart.

name: Mr. Brown
line: Now, I need you to take these forms. This kind of expresses the joint experience we had today. And I need you to look 'em over and sign them as kind of a group pledge.

name: Michael
line: I don't think I can sign this.

name: Mr. Brown
line: I can't leave until you do.

name: Michael
line: Well, OK, it says here that I learned something and I knew all this stuff already, so... I know, I could sign something that says that I taught something, or that I helped you teach something, so... Pam! Where is she? Pam, could we change something on this?

name: Mr. Brown
line: Michael, can I talk to you candidly?

name: Michael
line: Sure.

name: Mr. Brown
line: We both know that I'm here because of the comments you made.

name: Michael
line: Here's the thing. This office, I think this is very advanced in terms of... racial awareness and it's probably more advanced than you're used to. That's probably throwing you off a little bit.

name: Mr. Brown
line: Um, it's not throwing me. I need your signature.

name: Michael
line: OK, well I know. You told me that several times.

name: Mr. Brown
line: Yes, but you're not listening to me. Yours is the only signature I need.

name: Michael
line: OK.

name: Mr. Brown
line: Those are my instructions from the Corporate offices to put you through this seminar for the comments that you made. The reason I made copies for everyone was so you wouldn't be embarrassed.

name: Michael
line: Well, here I am thinking that you actually cared about diversity training. And you don't.

name: Mr. Brown
line: Don't worry about dating.

name: Michael
line: I won't.

name: Mr. Brown
line: OK. Thank you.

name: Michael
line: Yeah, yeah.

name: Michael
line: "I regret my actions. I regret offending my coworkers. I pledge to bring my best spirit of honesty, empathy, respect and open-mindedness..." Open-mindedness, is that even a word? "...into the workplace. In this way, I can truly be a hero. Signed, Daffy Duck." He's going to lose it when he reads that.

name: Jim
line: Yeah, hi. Is Mr. Decker around? Oh, well, could you just have him call me after lunch? Thank you.

name: Michael
line: "I pledge to always keep an open mind and an open heart." I do believe... in that part of the pledge I that just read. But a pledge? Come on. I mean who are we, the Girl Scouts? No. Look... the guy, "Mr. Brown," he got us halfway there. He got us talking. Well, no. I got us talking. He got us nothing. He insulted us and he abandoned us. You call that diversity training? I don't. Were there any connections between any of us? Did anyone look each other in the eye? Was there any emotion going on? No. Where was the heart? I didn't see any heart. Where was my Oprah moment? OK, get as much done as you can before lunch because, afterward, I'm going to have you all in tears.

name: Michael
line: All right? Everybody pretty? Come on. Here we go. It's time. Let's do some good.

name: Toby
line: Hey, we're not all going to sit in a circle Indian style are we?

name: Michael
line: Get out.

name: Toby
line: I'm sorry.

name: Michael
line: No, this is not a joke. OK? That was offensive and lame. So double offensive. This is an environment of welcoming and you should just get the hell out of here. OK, let's go. Let's do it. Come on. Let's have some fun, everybody. Here we go. Take a seat. Cop a squat. And um... thanks for coming in. Um... Diversity... is the cornerstone of progress as I've always said. But don't take my word for it. Let's take a look at the tape.

name: Michael
line: Hi. I'm Michael Scott. I'm in charge of Dunder Mifflin Paper Products here in Scranton, Pennsylvania but I'm also the founder of Diversity Tomorrow, because today is almost over. Abraham Lincoln once said that, "If you're a racist, I will attack you with the North." And those are the principles that I carry with me in the workplace.

name: Michael
line: OK. Questions? Comments? Anybody? Jim?

name: Michael
line: Yes. I only had an hour to put it together but I'm going to add on to it later on.

name: Kevin
line: It was kind of hard to hear.

name: Michael
line: Uh, yes. That probably had something to do with the camera work. Anybody else? Um...

name: Kelly
line: I have a customer meeting.

name: Michael
line: Yeah, well, if you leave we'll only have two left. Yes. Enjoy. Absolutely. Namaste. Ok, well since I am leading this, let's get down to business and why don't I just kind of introduce myself, OK? Um. I am Michael and I am part English, Irish, German and Scottish. Sort of a virtual United Nations. But what some of you might not know is that I am also part Native American Indian.

name: Oscar
line: What part Native American?

name: Michael
line: Two fifteenths.

name: Oscar
line: Two fifteenths, that fraction doesn't make any sense.

name: Michael
line: Well, you know what, it's kind of hard for me to talk about it. Their suffering. So who else? Let's get this popping. Come on. Who's going? Who's going? Let's go here. Oscar, right here. You're on.

name: Oscar
line: OK, Michael, um... Both my parents were born in Mexico.

name: Michael
line: Oh, yeah...

name: Oscar
line: And, uh, they moved to the United Sates a year before I was born. So I grew up in the United States.

name: Michael
line: Wow.

name: Oscar
line: My parents were Mexican.

name: Michael
line: Wow. That is... That is a great story. That's the American Dream right there, right?

name: Oscar
line: Thank... Yeah...

name: Michael
line: Um, let me ask you, is there a term besides Mexican that you prefer? Something less offensive?

name: Oscar
line: Mexican isn't offensive.

name: Michael
line: Well, it has certain connotations.

name: Oscar
line: Like what?

name: Michael
line: Like... I don't... I don't know.

name: Oscar
line: What connotations, Michael? You meant something.

name: Michael
line: No. Now, remember that honesty...

name: Oscar
line: I'm just curious.

name: Michael
line: ...empathy, respect... Jim! Jim!

name: Jim
line: Hello? Hello?

name: Michael
line: I have something here. I want you to take a card. Put it on your fore... Don't look at the card. I want you to take the card and put it on your forehead and... Take a card, take a card, any card. Um... And I want you to treat other people like the race that is on their forehead. OK? So everybody has a different race. Nobody knows what their race is, so... I want you to really go for it, cause this is real. You know, this isn't just an exercise. This is real life. And... I have a dream that you will really let the sparks fly. Get 'er done.

name: Michael
line: Why? Because Martin Luther King is a hero of mine. There's this great Chris Rock bit about how streets named after Martin Luther King tend to be more violent. I'm not going to do it but it's...

name: Michael
line: Oh this is a good one.

name: Pam
line: Um, hi. How are you?

name: Stanley
line: Fine. How are you?

name: Pam
line: Great.

name: Michael
line: Push it.

name: Stanley
line: I admire your culture's success in America.

name: Pam
line: Thank you.

name: Michael
line: Good. Bom bom bom-bom bom. Come on Olympics of Suffering right here. Slavery versus the Holocaust. Come on.

name: Stanley
line: Who am I supposed to be?

name: Michael
line: No, that was inadvertent. We didn't actually plan that.

name: Dwight
line: Lots of cultures eat rice, doesn't help me.

name: Dwight
line: Um... Shalom. I'd like to apply for a loan.

name: Pam
line: That's nice, Dwight.

name: Dwight
line: OK, do me. Something stereotypical so I can get it really quick.

name: Pam
line: OK, I like your food.

name: Dwight
line: Outback steakhouse. I'm Australian, mate!

name: Michael
line: Pam, come on. "I like your food." Come on stir the pot. Stir the melting pot, Pam! Let's do it. Let's get ugly. Let's get real.

name: Pam
line: OK. If I have to do this, based on stereotypes that are totally untrue, that I do not agree with, you would maybe not be a very good driver.

name: Dwight
line: Oh, man, am I a woman?

name: Michael
line: You'll notice I didn't have anybody be an Arab. I thought that would be too explosive. No pun intended. But I just though. "Too soon for Arabs." Maybe next year. Um... You know, the ball's in their court.

name: Jim
line: What are you watching?

name: Ryan
line: Chappelle's Show.

name: Jim
line: Really?

name: Ryan
line: I downloaded it on her computer. I hope she doesn't mind. She just had a lot of extra space.

name: Jim
line: No way. I think she likes this stuff.

name: Ryan
line: Great. She's cute, huh?

name: Jim
line: Yeah, you know, she's engaged, but...

name: Ryan
line: Oh, no, the girl in the... sketch.

name: Jim
line: Oh, yeah. She's hot.

name: Kevin
line: Hey.

name: Angela
line: Hey.

name: Kevin
line: You wanna go to the beach?

name: Angela
line: Sure.

name: Kevin
line: You wanna get high?

name: Angela
line: No.

name: Kevin
line: I think you do, mon.

name: Angela
line: Stop...

name: Michael
line: OK. All right. No. It's good. You just need to push it. You need to go a little bit further. All right. OK.

name: Michael
line: Kelly, how are you?

name: Kelly
line: I just had the longest meeting.

name: Michael
line: Oh! Welcome to my convenience store. Would you like some googi googi? I have some very delicious googi, googi, only 99 cents plus tax. Try my googi, googi. Try my googi, googi. Try my googi, googi. Try my...

name: Michael
line: All right! All right! Yes! That was great, she gets it! Now she knows what it's like to be a minority.

name: Jim
line: Mr. Decker, we didn't lose your sale today, did we? Excellent. OK. Let me just get your... what's that? No, we didn't close last time. I just need your... Oh. W-What code were you given? Oh, OK. That's actually another salesman here. I can redo it if you want to do that. Oh, he gave you a discount? No, I don't blame you.

name: Michael
line: I just hated it when that guy was in here. Mr. Brown, if that was his real name. I mean, he had never met any of us before, and here he was telling us how to do our thing. I just wanted... I just wanted to do it our way. You know? On our own. Man I should have gotten some food.

name: Kevin
line: Maybe some spagh-etti.

name: Michael
line: Okay, Kevin. You can take that off that thing, OK? That would really, really have shown him up, wouldn't it? If I'd brought in some burritos or some colored greens. Or some pad Thai. I love pad Thai.

name: Stanley
line: It's collard greens.

name: Michael
line: What?

name: Stanley
line: It's collard greens.

name: Michael
line: That doesn't really make sense. Because you don't call them collared people, that's offensive. Hmmm... OK, well, it's after five. So... Thank you very much. Buena vista Oscar. Thank you. Good job. Oh, my man. Thank you Brazil. Nice.

name: Jim
line: Um... Hey.

name: Pam
line: Mmmm.

name: Jim
line: Hey.

name: Pam
line: Oh.

name: Jim
line: We can go.

name: Pam
line: Sorry.

name: Jim
line: That's fine.

name: Jim
line: Uh... Not a bad day.

name: Michael
line: Pam. Pamela. Pam-elama-ding-dong. Making copies.

name: Pam
line: I'm not making any copies.

name: Michael
line: Let's go. Messages. Stat. Lots to do, lots to do. Information superhighway.

name: Pam
line: Nothing new.

name: Michael
line: Lay them on me. What?

name: Pam
line: There's nothing new.

name: Michael
line: That's not what you said earlier.

name: Pam
line: Oh, do you want me to repeat the messages that I gave you before for the...

name: Michael
line: The most sacred thing I do is care and provide for my workers, my family. I give them money. I give them food. Not directly, but through the money. I heal them. Today, I am in charge of picking a great new health care plan. Right? That's what this is all about. Does that make me their doctor? Um... Yes, in a way. Yeah, like a specialist.

name: Jan
line: So, which health plan have you decided on?

name: Michael
line: I am going to go with the best, Jan. I am going to go with the one with the acupuncture, therapeutic massage, you know, the works.

name: Jan
line: Wait, acupuncture? None of the plans have acupuncture. Have you looked at them closely Michael?

name: Michael
line: I think it was you who didn't look closely enough at the Gold Plan.

name: Jan
line: The Gold Plan? I'm not even on that plan.

name: Michael
line: Well, I'd recommend it. It's very good.

name: Jan
line: Michael.

name: Michael
line: You gotta crack these things open.

name: Jan
line: You know the whole reason that we're doing this, is to save money. So you just need to pick a provider and choose the cheapest plan.

name: Michael
line: Well, that is kind of a tough assignment. Um... It won't be popular decision around the old orifice.

name: Jan
line: It's your job. So...

name: Michael
line: Well, it's a suicide mission, you know.

name: Jan
line: Michael... maybe... I mean...

name: Michael
line: There, there...

name: Jan
line: Sometimes a manager, like yourself, has to deliver the bad news to the employees. I do it all the time.

name: Michael
line: When have you ever done that?

name: Jan
line: I'm doing it right now. To you.

name: Jim
line: Last night on Trading Spouses, there's... have you seen it?

name: Pam
line: No. I have a life.

name: Jim
line: Interesting, what's that like?

name: Pam
line: You should try it sometime.

name: Jim
line: Wow. But then who would watch my TV? That is...

name: Pam
line: ... your problem.

name: Michael
line: Jimbo! Ha haaaaa. Ah.

name: Michael
line: There's a decision that needs to be made, and I'm having an unbelievably a busy day. So I'm going to let you pick a health care plan for our office and then explain it to your co-workers.

name: Jim
line: Gosh.

name: Michael
line: Yeah!

name: Jim
line: That is a great offer. Thank you. I really think I should be concentrating on sales.

name: Michael
line: Really?

name: Jim
line: Yeah. I just don't think this is the kind of task, that I... am going to do. You know who would be great for this?

name: Jim
line: Any time Michael asks me to do anything, I just tell him that Dwight should do it.

name: Dwight
line: Yes. I can do it. I'm your man.

name: Jim
line: Right now, this is just a job. If I advance any higher in this company then this would be my career. And uh, well, if this were my career, I'd have to throw myself in front of a train.

name: Dwight
line: OK, first, let's go over some parameters. How many people can I fire?

name: Michael
line: Ah, none. You're picking a health care plan.

name: Dwight
line: OK, we'll table that for the time being. Two, I'll need an office. I think the conference room should be fine.

name: Michael
line: You can use the conference room as a temporary workspace.

name: Dwight
line: Yes, I have an office. Bigger than his.

name: Michael
line: Nope, you cannot use it.

name: Dwight
line: OK, I take it back, it's a workspace.

name: Michael
line: Temporary workspace. You can use it.

name: Dwight
line: Thank you.

name: Michael
line: If Dwight fails, then that is strike two, and good for me for, ah, for giving him a second chance. And if he succeeds, then, you know, no one will be prouder than I am. I groomed him. I made him what he is today. Unless he fails, and we've talked about that already.

name: Dwight
line: What did I do? I did my job. I slashed benefits to the bone. I saved this company money. Was I too harsh? Maybe. I don't believe in coddling people.

name: Dwight
line: In the wild, there is no health care. In the wild, health care is, "Ow, I hurt my leg. I can't run. A lion eats me and I'm dead." Well, I'm not dead. I'm the lion. You're dead.

name: Stanley
line: There's no dental, there's no vision, there's a $1,200 deductible.

name: Pam
line: Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam.

name: Michael
line: Pam, Michael Scott. How's tricks?

name: Pam
line: Where are you?

name: Michael
line: Oh, I am in my office. I am swamped. I have work up to my ears I'm busy, busy, busy. Can't step away. I just wanted to check in and see how everybody's doing. Everybody cool out there?

name: Pam
line: Actually, people are really unhappy. Um, Dwight sent around this memo and people are freaking out 'cause the...

name: Michael
line: Pam! Whoa, whoa, I'm sorry, I'm sorry, I, I, I, I gotta go. I'm getting a call.

name: Pam
line: No you're not.

name: Michael
line: I have to make a call after I finish... my work. You know what? Uh, just don't let anybody in my office under any conditions today. I'm just too busy. Too swamped, you know? I am unreachable. I am incommunicado, capisce?

name: Pam
line: OK.

name: Michael
line: Thank you, Oh, gah, here we go again. Gotta go, I have to take this.

name: Pam
line: Still no one calling.

name: Pam
line: Dwight, what...

name: Dwight
line: Uh, knock, please. Please knock. This is an office.

name: Jim
line: It says "workspace".

name: Dwight
line: Same thing.

name: Jim
line: If it's the same thing, then why did you write "workspace"?

name: Dwight
line: Just knock, Please? As a sign of respect for your superior.

name: Jim
line: You are not my superior.

name: Dwight
line: Oh gee, then why do I have an office?

name: Jim
line: I thought it was a workspace?

name: Pam
line: OK. Dwight. Are you really in charge of picking the health care plan?

name: Dwight
line: Yes. And my decision in final.

name: Pam
line: This is a ridiculously awful plan. Because you cut everything.

name: Dwight
line: Aww, times are tough, Pam. Deal with it.

name: Jim
line: You cut more than you had to, didn't you?

name: Dwight
line: Sure.

name: Jim
line: Well, why did you do that? You work here, don't you want good insurance?

name: Dwight
line: Don't need it. Never been sick. Perfect immune system.

name: Jim
line: OK, well, if you've never been sick, then you don't have any antibodies.

name: Dwight
line: I don't need them. Superior genes. I'm a Schrute. And superior brain power. Through concentration, I can raise and lower my cholesterol at will.

name: Pam
line: Why would you want to raise your cholesterol?

name: Dwight
line: So I can lower it.

name: Oscar
line: He literally won't come out of his office.

name: Kevin
line: He's got to come out sometime. To go to the bathroom.

name: Angela
line: Kevin! That's inappropriate.

name: Oscar
line: Michael, can I talk to you?

name: Michael
line: Ah, uh, I would love to, but I am really busy. Rain check?

name: Meredith
line: Michael. Michael, please, can we talk to you about this memo?

name: Michael
line: Ah, what? Which memo?

name: Pam
line: Dwight's health care memo. I told you about it.

name: Michael
line: Is it a good plan?

name: Dwight
line: It's a great plan. It saves the company a fortune.

name: Oscar
line: It's like a pay decrease.

name: Pam
line: Michael, he made huge cuts.

name: Michael
line: Cuts? What? Wow, Dwight, did you make cuts?

name: Dwight
line: Yeah, you said...

name: Michael
line: No, no , no, you know what? I said nothing specific because I was so busy. Why don't you go in there and find these people a plan that will work for them? OK?

name: Dwight
line: I can handle that.

name: Michael
line: OK? All right. Do we feel good? All right. Good. Plus, there's some other good news. Today, at the end of the day, I will have, for all of you, a big surprise. OK? So hang in there, and I will see you at the end of the day. Right?

name: Oscar
line: This is not good.

name: Angela
line: It's ridiculous. Did you talk to him?

name: Oscar
line: What was that?

name: Angela
line: You let him walk all over you. It's just pathetic.

name: Kevin
line: What are you guys talking about?

name: Angela
line: Nothing, Kevin.

name: Michael
line: Do I know what the surprise is? Hell no! It doesn't matter. The point is, they're not unhappy anymore. They're out there thinking, "Wow, my boss really cares about me. He has a surprise. He's cool. I... what a great guy. I love him. I... love him.

name: Dwight
line: OK, everyone. Gather round. Step forward. It has been brought to my attention that some of you are unhappy with my plan. So what I'd like you to do is to fill this out and write down any diseases you have that you might want covered and I'll see what I can do.

name: Jim
line: OK, you know what Dwight? We can't write our diseases down for you because that's confidential.

name: Dwight
line: OK, well, I didn't say to write your name down, did I? Fill it out, leave it anonymous. Or, don't write any disease down at all and it won't be covered. Sound fair? Good. I'll be in my office.

name: Jim
line: Workspace.

name: Michael
line: You know what? Come with me. We are going on a little mission. Operation Surprise.

name: Pam
line: Where are you going?

name: Michael
line: Um, headed out. Part of my busy day, you know. Meetings. Couldn't find the knob.

name: Michael
line: So, basically, I want to do something nice for my employees. Atlantic City, OK? They have this thing where they send a bus, right, for free. Picks everybody up, you head down there, get to the hotel, room is comped, they give you a pile of chips, and your food, everything just kind of all-inclusive, free kind of weekend.

name: Travel Agent
line: I don't know of anything like that, but, um, you know what you might want to do, is just call those casinos directly. Um, maybe?

name: Michael
line: Yeah, yeah, yeah. I did, so...

name: Jim
line: Wait. What are you writing? Don't write Ebola or mad cow disease. Right? 'Cause I'm suffering from both.

name: Pam
line: I'm inventing new diseases.

name: Jim
line: Oh, great.

name: Pam
line: So, let's say my teeth turn to liquid and then, they drip down the back of my throat. What would you call that?

name: Jim
line: I thought you said you were inventing diseases? That's spontaneous dental hydroplosion.

name: Pam
line: Nice.

name: Jim
line: Thank you.

name: Michael
line: Calling you to ask you a little favoroonie my friend. Um, trying to give the troops around here a little bit of a boost. And I was thinking that maybe we could take them down to take a spin on your big ride.

name: Man on Phone
line: You mean the elevator that takes you down into the mineshaft? It's not really a ride.

name: Michael
line: Its says here that it's a 300ft drop.

name: Man on Phone
line: It goes 300 feet into the earth, but it moves really slowly.

name: Michael
line: So it's not a free fall?

name: Man on Phone
line: It's an industrial coal elevator.

name: Michael
line: Uh, all right. Well, once you get down into the mine, what... you got laser tag or something?

name: Michael
line: OK, so I don't know what the surprise is. Am I worried? No. No way. See, I thrive on this. This is my world. This is improv. This is Whose Line is it Anyway?

name: Dwight
line: Damnit! Damnit Jim!

name: Dwight
line: All right, who did this? I'm not mad. I just want to know who did it so I can punish them.

name: Jim
line: What are you talking about?

name: Dwight
line: Uh, someone forged, uh, medical information and that is a felony.

name: Jim
line: OK, whoa. 'Cause that is a pretty intense accusation. How do you know that they're fake?

name: Dwight
line: Uh, leprosy? Flesh eating bacteria. Hot-dog fingers. Government-created killer nanorobot infection.

name: Dwight
line: You did this, didn't you?

name: Jim
line: Absolutely not.

name: Dwight
line: Yes you did.

name: Jim
line: No I didn't.

name: Dwight
line: I know it was you. Fine. You know what? I'll have to interview each and every one of you until the perpetrator makes him or herself known. And until that time, there will be no health care coverage for any one!

name: Jim
line: Killer nanorobots?

name: Pam
line: It's an epidemic.

name: Dwight
line: The problem, Jim, is that people who are really suffering from a medical condition won't receive the care they need, because someone in this office is coming up with all this ridiculous stuff. "Count Choculitis"

name: Jim
line: Sounds tough.

name: Dwight
line: Why did you write that down Jim? Is it because you know I love Count Chocula?

name: Jim
line: Do you?

name: Dwight
line: I think you need to confess...

name: Jim
line: Mmm hmm.

name: Dwight
line: ...the fact...

name: Jim
line: Yep.

name: Dwight
line: What are you doing? Those are my keys.

name: Jim
line: Good luck.

name: Dwight
line: Jim! Damnit! No! Jim! Let me out! Jim! Let...

name: Stanley
line: ...the light green or green...

name: Jim
line: Jim Halpert.

name: Dwight
line: Let me out.

name: Jim
line: Who is this?

name: Dwight
line: Let me out or you're fired.

name: Jim
line: No, you can't fire me.

name: Dwight
line: Yes I can. I'm manager for the day. Clean out your desk.

name: Jim
line: OK, can you hold on? I'm getting the, ah, beep.] Jim Halpert.

name: Pam
line: Hey, Jim. It's Pam.

name: Jim
line: Hey Pam! How are you?

name: Dwight
line: Jim! Open the door!

name: Pam
line: Good, how are you? Busy?

name: Jim
line: I'm doing OK. Getting excited for the weekend though. What are you up to?

name: Dwight
line: Jim!

name: Pam
line: Um, I'm not bothering you, am I?

name: Jim
line: No, not at all.

name: Pam
line: You don't have anything you're doing?

name: Jim
line: I have nothing to do.

name: Dwight
line: Jim!

name: Pam
line: Oh great. Um, no, this weekend? Nothing. I'm not really doing anything.

name: Dwight
line: Jim!

name: Jim
line: Oh yeah?

line: You can't. You can't. But I promise I'll never betray you again. What can I do, Michael. What can I do? What can I do? What can I do? What can I do?

name: Michael
line: Kevin, would you like to do the scenes from last week?

name: Michael
line: You can get up. Get up. And you can hug it out, bitch.

name: Kevin
line: Yes!

name: Michael
line: Hug it out, bitch. That is what men say to each other, after a fight. They hug it out, and doing so, the just... let it go. And walk away. And they're done. Not a good idea to say that to a woman however. I have found. It doesn't translate.

name: Dwight
line: Why him?

name: Michael
line: Don't whine. Get the window.

name: Michael
line: Previously on Varsity Blues...

name: Michael
line: Yep. Yeah, we hugged it out. But, it turns out, I was still a little angry. So, I felt I needed to punish him, just a little bit more, and I'm making him do my laundry for a year.

name: Kevin
line: Ok. Billy-Bob, got a head injury, but coach made him play. So then Lance, he gets sacked, he's out for the year...

name: Jan
line: Hello?

name: Dwight
line: Not everyone approves of Movie Monday. I won't say who.

name: Angela
line: I don't approve. I don't.

name: Jan
line: Hello?

name: Michael
line: Hi Jan! Hope you brought the Milk Duds!

name: Jan
line: How would a movie increase productivity Michael? How on earth would it do that?

name: Michael
line: People work faster after...

name: Jan
line: Magically?

name: Michael
line: No... they have to... to make up for the time they lost watching the movie.

name: Jan
line: No.

name: Angela
line: Kitchen.

name: Angela
line: Michael is going to get us all fired. You sat back and let him play that dumb movie, and now Jan is peeved off and we're all going to lose our jobs.

name: Dwight
line: That's not going to happen.

name: Angela
line: You know she has it out for him now.

name: Dwight
line: That's not his fault! He had to follow his heart!

name: Dwight
line: Ever since Michael dumped Jan for Carol, Jan's been bitching out on him. Reject a woman and she will never let it go. One of the many defects of their kind. Also weak arms.

name: Angela
line: Dwight, you should be running this office.

name: Dwight
line: Michael would never let me...

name: Angela
line: It's not up to Michael, it's Jan's call. Talk to her.

name: Dwight
line: I could never do that!

name: Angela
line: Fine! Sit back and do nothing and let us all get fired!

name: Angela
line: I know that patience and loyalty are good, and virtuous traits. But sometimes I just think you need to grow a pair.

name: Jim
line: At the Stamford branch, they all play this World War II video game called Call of Duty, and they're all really into it. I'm told it started as a team building exercise. Unfortunately I really suck at it. We didn't play many video games in Scranton. Instead we'd do stuff like, uh, Pam and I would sometimes hum the same high pitched note, and try to get Dwight to make an appointment with an ear doctor. And uh, Pam called it... Pretendenitus.

name: Pam
line: Hey Kelly, my stuff just got here.

name: Pam
line: Kelly really likes to online shop. Soooo, I felt like I wanted some new clothes. I mean, I just, I wanted to, it just, I felt like it was time, to maybe um... just get new clothes.

name: Pam
line: Ok.

name: Kelly
line: I love it!

name: Pam
line: Really? I don't know.

name: Kelly
line: You haven't even tried it on yet, try it on.

name: Pam
line: Not at work, I'll try it on---

name: Kelly
line: Fashion show! Fashion show! Fashion show at lunch!

name: Pam
line: ...noooo

name: Kelly
line: Fashion show! Fashion show! Fashion show at lunch! Fashion show! Fashion show! Fashion show at lunch!

name: Andy
line: Why did you do that?!

name: Jim
line: I'm just killing Germans, any way I can.

name: Andy
line: We're on the German team. Shoot the Brittish.

line: Wait, are we playing teams?

line: Yeah.

line: WAH! GAH!

name: Jan
line: Hello?

name: Dwight
line: Is this Jan?

name: Jan
line: Who is this?

name: Dwight
line: This is Dwight Schrute. I am calling about an extremely sensitive matter.

name: Jan
line: You should talk to Michael, and he'll talk to me, and that way we don't have to speak to each other.

name: Dwight
line: It's about Michael.

name: Jan
line: What about him?

name: Dwight
line: I can't talk here. It's too sensitive.

name: Jan
line: It's not about a surprise party is it?

name: Dwight
line: No, but we should discuss that another time.

name: Jan
line: Look, I am already an hour outside of Scranton, Dwight, I'm not coming back.

name: Dwight
line: Pull over at exit 40. There is a Liz Claiborne outlet. I know you like that store. Go inside and shop, until I can meet you.

name: Jan
line: How do you know I like that store?

name: Dwight
line: Many of your blouses are Claiborne's.

name: Jan
line: How do you know that?

name: Dwight
line: Part of my job.

name: Jan
line: No it's not. It's officially not.

name: Dwight
line: ...noted.

name: Dwight
line: I'm going... to the dentist.

name: Michael
line: Ok.

name: Dwight
line: I have to have an emergency crown put in.

name: Michael
line: Ouchy.

name: Dwight
line: Yes. It's a new dentist. He's far. I might be gone... three hours.

name: Michael
line: Three hours, wow. Have fun.

name: Dwight
line: Did you get anything good?

name: Jan
line: Yeah.

name: Dwight
line: New blouse? Halter top? Camisole? Teddy?

name: Dwight
line: I can save the branch.

name: Jan
line: Really?

name: Dwight
line: If you let me run it.

name: Jan
line: Ok.

name: Dwight
line: "Ok" I can run it?

name: Jan
line: What would you do differently?

name: Dwight
line: Mostly get rid of waste. Which is half the people there. And clean house. Right here. It's all for me. Thank you.

name: Jan
line: Dwight, you must feel strongly, to speak with me this way, behind Michael's back, and turn on so many of your co-workers.

name: Dwight
line: The decision to turn on Michael was difficult. But once I did it, I didn't look back. And mostly I feel that Michael would approve. It's really what's best for the branch. And I could care less about my co-workers. So, here we are. It's all, on the table. I want... the branch. And I await your decision.

name: Dwight
line: Oh, by the way. There's a new Ann Taylor outlet store near here. I know you like their earrings.

name: Jan
line: Where is it?

name: Jan
line: Michael.

name: Michael
line: Hi.

name: Jan
line: I just had a very interesting conversation with one of your employees.

name: Michael
line: Oh. That's nice.

name: Jan
line: No, it wasn't. Dwight just told me that he thinks he can run the branch better than you.

name: Michael
line: ...what?

name: Jan
line: Mm-hmm.

name: Michael
line: ...you were at the dentist?

name: Jan
line: You can't have people undermining you. Get control of your branch immediately.

name: Michael
line: Ok.

name: Michael
line: What was Dwight thinking? That he could turn Jan against me? She's my ex-lover! ...ish.

name: Phyllis
line: Woooooow.

name: Kelly
line: It's so sexy. You look so hot.

name: Phyllis
line: It's really something.

name: Pam
line: It's too much.

name: Kelly
line: What?

name: Pam
line: I'm gonna return it.

name: Kelly
line: No, you have to keep it today, just see how you feel.

name: Pam
line: Hi.

line: You look nice.

name: Pam
line: Thanks.

line: Isn't that like your third soda today?

name: Jim

line: Scared?

line: Call of Duty!

name: Josh
line: Andy, Jim, can I see you in the conference room for a minute?

name: Andy
line: Now?

name: Josh
line: Yes now.

name: Andy
line: Put the game on hold everyone.

name: Josh
line: This is not working, ok? We are getting slaughtered out there.

name: Andy
line: It's the new guy.

name: Jim
line: Oh, I'm sorry I don't know... what we're talking about...

name: Andy
line: See what I mean?

name: Josh
line: We just need a strategy, ok? We're going to set up a trap in the gun room. All right Jim, are you using the MP-40 or the 44?

name: Jim
line: Um, sniper rifle?

name: Josh
line: SNIPE--

line: WHAT?

name: Josh
line: JIM!

name: Andy
line: Are you playing for the other team?!

name: Josh
line: You don't snipe in Carrington, ok?

name: Andy
line: Saboteur!

name: Josh
line: Andy, it's not---

name: Andy
line: Saboteur! I'm going to kill you for real. This game--- the game is over. I'm really going to shoot you.

name: Michael
line: Hey Dwight.

name: Dwight
line: Hey.

name: Michael
line: Do you want an M&M?

name: Dwight
line: No thanks I'm stuffed.

name: Michael
line: No seriously. You should have an M&M, they're really good.

name: Michael
line: They're good, huh?

name: Dwight
line: ...so good.

name: Michael
line: Hey. I thought you weren't supposed to eat anything for a couple hours after you've had a crown put in.

name: Dwight
line: They have this new kind of quick drying bonding, so...

name: Michael
line: Sounds like a good dentist.

name: Dwight
line: Oh, yeah.

name: Michael
line: What's his name?

name: Dwight
line: Crentist.

name: Michael
line: Your dentist's name is Crentist.

name: Dwight
line: Yep.

name: Michael
line: Huh. Sounds a lot like dentist.

name: Dwight
line: Maybe that's why he became a dentist.

name: Michael
line: Let me see your teeth. Let me see 'em. Let me see 'em.

name: Dwight
line: Ahh. Aaaah.

name: Michael
line: You should... floss.

name: Dwight
line: I know...

name: Michael
line: Well then... I am glad you're ok.

name: Michael
line: Business is like a jungle. And I... am like a tiger. And Dwight, is like a monkey, that stabs the tiger in the back with a stick. Does the tiger fire the monkey? Does the tiger transfer the monkey to another branch? Pun. There is no way of knowing what goes on inside the tiger's head. We don't have the technology.

name: Michael
line: Dwight, can I talk to you for a second?

name: Michael
line: Wow, this is tough.

name: Dwight
line: What?

name: Michael
line: Ohhhh. Arrrgggh!

name: Dwight
line: What is it?

name: Michael
line: Well, I just got off the phone with Jan. And um... she demoted me.

name: Dwight
line: No.

name: Michael
line: Yeah. You know what the craziest part of this is? She demoted me to your job!

name: Dwight
line: Gahh!

name: Michael
line: And she said that you should be expecting a call later from corporate, and that um, I guess that means that you are going to be acting manager of Dunder Mifflin, Scranton.

name: Dwight
line: I can't believe this news. That--- wow.

name: Michael
line: I know. I told her I didn't know whether you'd wanna do it... because you've always been so loyal to me. You've been my most trusted ally.

name: Dwight
line: You said that?

name: Michael
line: Yep, I did. I did. But I think... you should do it.

name: Dwight
line: Well... Gosh, if you think I should. Then I will.

name: Michael
line: Perfect, well, we're settled.

name: Dwight
line: All right.

name: Michael
line: All right. Well then, you are now acting manager of Dunder Mifflin Scranton Branch, and I... am assistant regional manager.

name: Dwight
line: Assistant to the regional manager. Thank you Michael, for staying on. I really appreciate it.

name: Michael
line: Ohh..

name: Dwight
line: Hey... I can't imagine this place without you.

name: Michael
line: Can't you? That's so nice.

name: Michael
line: Well... I guess we should go tell the troops.

name: Dwight
line: Yeah, when I'm ready, Mike. Ok let's do it.

name: Michael
line: Hey, hi, hello. Everybody, I have some good news, and I have some bad news. I... am being replaced, as your leader, by Dwight.

name: Phyllis
line: You're kidding...

name: Michael
line: You might think that I am kidding, and I understand that.

name: Angela
line: Congratulations Dwight.

name: Dwight
line: Thank you Angela.

name: Stanley
line: But... why Dwight?

name: Michael
line: Because, Dwight... never lies.

name: Stanley
line: How does that qualify him to run a branch?

name: Michael
line: Because that's all it takes.

name: Michael
line: Ok, Dwight, would you like to say a few words to everybody... about loyalty?

name: Dwight
line: Thank you Michael. I just want to say, to the few of you who will remain under my employ, that I intend to lead you into the black! With ferocity!

name: Phyllis
line: Michael, what will you do?

name: Michael
line: Oh, I'll be fine.

name: Kevin
line: Do you have any savings?

name: Michael
line: No, no, I don't, but---

name: Kevin
line: Michael, you might lose your condo.

name: Michael
line: I... won't. I won't.

name: Pam
line: I have this little vacuum cleaner that's broken. If Dwight doesn't work out, maybe that could be manager.

name: Phyllis
line: Maybe I'll quit.

name: Angela
line: It's really happening!

name: Dwight
line: Yes.

name: Angela
line: We can make a difference here.

name: Dwight
line: I, will, make a difference here.

name: Angela
line: You alone? Because I thought together we could---

name: Dwight
line: Oh please, don't be naive. But you can be in charge of the women.

name: Karen
line: Look how cute he is! He's trying to shoot with a smoke grenade.

line: I'm sorry what are you whispering about?

name: Karen
line: I'm sorry nothing, just concentrate on turning around.

name: Jim
line: I'm trying---

name: Karen
line: Just tap S then D.

name: Jim
line: Oh.

name: Karen
line: Any... last words? No?

name: Jim
line: What?

name: Jim
line: Wow. Psychopath.

name: Pam
line: What?

name: Creed
line: I'm just looking.

name: Pam
line: Please go back to your desk.

name: Creed
line: In a minute.

name: Pam
line: Well, I remember why I dress the way I do at work. But I'm gonna keep the clothes. I mean, it'll be cool to just have some after work clothes that aren't pajamas.

name: Michael
line: Well, I guess it's time, that I turn over the keys, to the famous Sebring.

name: Dwight
line: No thank you.

name: Michael
line: It's a corporate lease Dwight, you've earned it.

name: Dwight
line: No thanks.

name: Michael
line: What?

name: Dwight
line: Not my style.

name: Michael
line: But you said you liked it. You've always admired it.

name: Dwight
line: Well that was before. I'm thinking about getting something German, something with decent gas mileage. Plus, that convertible, it's a ridiculous choice for this climate.

name: Michael
line: Take it back.

name: Dwight
line: No.

name: Michael
line: That's my car.

name: Dwight
line: What did you---

name: Michael
line: THAT'S MY CAR.

name: Dwight
line: Yes.

name: Michael
line: I know, Dwight. I know. I know. I know.

name: Dwight
line: You know what?

name: Michael
line: Jan called me about your little meeting!

name: Dwight
line: No!

name: Michael
line: I know, what you did. I made the whole thing up, Dwight.

name: Dwight
line: I think the Sebring's cool. It's cool. The Seabring's cool. It has a cassette and it has a CD.

name: Michael
line: Hey Ryan, can I get you a pencil from the warehouse?

name: Ryan
line: Uh, no thanks, I'm good.

name: Michael
line: Oh, it's okay, I'm going down.

name: Ryan
line: Um... Yeah, absolutely.

name: Michael
line: All right, I'll be right back.

name: Dwight
line: Whoo!

name: Michael
line: There you go.

name: Dwight
line: Awesome!

name: Ryan
line: Thank you.

name: Michael
line: You're welcome.

name: Dwight
line: Michael, can you get me a pen from down in the warehouse?

name: Michael
line: Don't mind if I do. See you in a minute.

name: Dwight
line: Okay. Whoo!

name: Michael
line: There you go, fresh from the warehouse.

name: Pam
line: Hey Michael, would you get me some coffee from the warehouse?

name: Michael
line: There's coffee in the kitchen, Pam.

name: Pam
line: But the warehouse coffee tastes SO much better.

name: Ryan and others
line: Yeah. Yes, it's better. It's great.

name: Michael
line: All right. Okay.

name: Michael
line: I am like Bette Midler in For the Boys. Gotta keep the troops entertained.

name: Pam
line: With cream and sugar?

name: Michael
line: All right.

name: Jan
line: So, I wanted to let you know that we lost Ed Truck.

name: Michael
line: Oookay. Let me see if I have his cell. Is this the only reason you are calling, Jan? Or does somebody miss me?

name: Jan
line: Michael, Ed died over the weekend.

name: Michael
line: Oh, wow.

name: Michael
line: Attention, everybody. I just received a call from corporate with some news they felt that I should know first. My old boss Ed Truck has died.

name: Kelly
line: Oh, Michael, that's such terrible news! You must feel so sad.

name: Michael
line: Yes, I am. It's very sad. Because he was my boss.

name: Phyllis
line: That's a shame. Ed was a good guy.

name: Michael
line: That's right, you worked with him. So did Creed. Well, I'll be in my office in case anybody wants to drop by. Cheer me up.

name: Michael
line: So did you hear the news?

name: Pam
line: The news that you just announced? That Ed died?

name: Michael
line: Yeah.

name: Pam
line: Is there anything I can do?

name: Michael
line: Oh, gosh, what can anybody do, really? It's... pssssh... . He was almost 70. Circle of life.

name: Pam
line: Yeah.

name: Pam
line: Oh. Okay.

name: Michael
line: Yeah. Mmmmmm.

name: Pam
line: Okay.

name: Josh
line: What's going on with Fairfield County schools? Karen, did you generate that price list?

name: Karen
line: Um, shoot. Uh, I will. Sorry.

name: Josh
line: Okay, just get it done. Jim, will you make sure?

name: Jim
line: Oh yeah, definitely.

name: Andy
line: Suck up! Josh, did you hear what I said?

name: Josh
line: Thank you, everyone.

name: Karen
line: Dammit.

name: Jim
line: What's up?

name: Karen
line: Uh, nothing. They're just out of Herr's chips.

name: Jim
line: Oh.

name: Karen
line: But don't worry about it. My snack food doesn't fall under the umbrella of your authority.

name: Jim
line: Mmm, that's where you're wrong. I'm your project supervisor today, and I have just decided that we're not doing anything until you get the chips that you require. So, I think we should go get some. Now, please.

name: Creed
line: It's a real shame about Ed, huh?

name: Michael
line: Yeah. Must really have you thinkin'.

name: Creed
line: About what?

name: Michael
line: The older you get, the bigger the chance is you're gonna die. You knew that.

name: Creed
line: Ed was decapitated.

name: Michael
line: What?

name: Dwight
line: Really?

name: Creed
line: He was drunk as a skunk, he was flying down Route 6. He slides under an 18 wheeler. Pop. It snaps right off.

name: Michael
line: Oh my God.

name: Dwight
line: That is the way to go. Instant death. Very smart.

name: Creed
line: You know a human can go on living for several hours after being decapitated.

name: Dwight
line: You're thinking of a chicken.

name: Creed
line: What did I say?

name: Michael
line: That is just not the way a Dunder Mifflin manager should go, I'm sorry. Alone, out of the blue, and not even have his own head to comfort him.

name: Michael
line: So, I'm not exactly sure how to say this...

name: Dwight
line: Ed was decapitated.

name: Michael
line: What are you doing?

name: Dwight
line: You said you didn't know how to say it.

name: Michael
line: I didn't... he was driving on the road and he went under a truck. And that's when his head was separated from the rest of him. And I will let you know more as soon as I find out.

name: Dwight
line: Hey.

name: Angela
line: Hi.

name: Dwight
line: If my head ever comes off, I would like you to put it on ice.

name: Angela
line: I do not wanna talk about this.

name: Dwight
line: When I die, I wanna be frozen. And if they have to freeze me in pieces, so be it. I will wake up stronger than ever because I will have used that time to figure out exactly why I died and what moves I could have used to defend myself better now that I know what hold he had me in.

name: Michael
line: I don't understand. We have a day honoring Martin Luther King, but he didn't even work here.

name: Jan
line: I understand how you feel, Michael. I really do. So, would it be helpful to give everyone the day off?

name: Michael
line: You really don't get it, do you? You don't understand these people. That is the last thing that they would want is a day off.

name: Jan
line: Well, what would you suggest?

name: Michael
line: A statue.

name: Jan
line: Of Ed?

name: Michael
line: Yeah.

name: Jan
line: I'm not sure that's realistic.

name: Michael
line: Well, I think it would be very realistic, it would look just like him.

name: Jan
line: No, that's not---

name: Michael
line: We could have his eyes light up, we could have his arms move...

name: Dwight
line: That is not a statue, that is a robot.

name: Michael
line: I think that is a great way to honor Ed.

name: Dwight
line: And how big do you want this robot?

name: Michael
line: Life-size.

name: Dwight
line: Mm, no. Better make it two-thirds. Easier to stop if it turns on us.

name: Jan
line: What the hell are you two talking about?

name: Michael
line: Well, we are talking about how to properly honor a man who gave his life as regional manager of this company, Jan.

name: Jan
line: You know what, Michael? I've really tried with you today...

name: Michael
line: Mm hm.

name: Jan
line: ...and I have to get back to work.

name: Michael
line: Oh do you? You know who wished they could get back to work is Ed Truck.

name: Jan
line: So call me when you feel like having a real conversation.

name: Michael
line: But Ed truck can't because he is---

name: Jan
line: Goodbye.

name: Michael
line: DEAD.

name: Dwight
line: Look I gave him a six foot extension cord so he can't chase us.

name: Michael
line: That's perfect.

name: Jim
line: Okay, that is a "no" on the on the West Side Market.

name: Karen
line: Okay, great. I think that's enough. Can I get back to work now?

name: Jim
line: Wow. Never pegged you for a quitter.

name: Karen
line: I am NOT a quitter. I will do this all day if you want.

name: Jim
line: Really?

name: Karen
line: Yeah, all day.

name: Andy
line: Hey. What are we doing? What's the game? I want in.

name: Jim
line: Oh, there's no game. We're just trying to get these chips for Karen.

name: Andy
line: Did you check the vending machine?

name: Karen
line: Oh, the vending machines! How did we miss that?

name: Jim
line: I have no idea. We went right for the copier.

name: Karen
line: Mm.

name: Jim
line: And then we checked the fax machine.

name: Karen
line: Yeah, nothing there.

name: Andy
line: Did you check your... butt?

name: Michael
line: Oohh... can you imagine how much blood there was? If it happened right here, it would reach all the way to reception. Probably get on Pam.

name: Phyllis
line: Okay that's enough.

name: Michael
line: What?

name: Stanley
line: We do not wanna hear about this.

name: Michael
line: Well, you know what? I didn't wanna hear about it either, Stanley, but I did and now I can't stop picturing it. He leaves work, he's on his way home... wham! His cappa is detated from his head!

name: Stanley
line: You have just spit on my face.

name: Michael
line: Well, you know what? There's something wrong with you. There is something wrong with everybody in here. Because we have lost a member of our family and you don't wanna talk about it, you don't wanna think about it, you just wanna get back to work!

name: Michael
line: There are five stages to grief, which are denial, anger, bargaining, depression, and acceptance. And right now, out there, they're all denying the fact that they're sad. And that's hard. And it's making them all angry. And it is my job to try to get them all the way through to acceptance. And if not acceptance, then just depression. If I can get them depressed, then I'll have done my job.

name: Michael
line: I am going to throw you this ball. When you catch the ball, I want you to say the name of a person very important to you, somebody really special who died, and then I want you to say how they died, and you may cry if you like, that is encouraged. Let me just start. Let me show you how this works. I catch the ball. I lost Ed Truck. And... it feels like somebody took my heart and dropped it into a bucket of boiling tears... and at the same time, somebody else is hitting my soul in the crotch with a frozen sledgehammer... and then a third guy walks in and starts punching me in the grief bone... and I'm crying, and nobody can hear me, because I am terribly, terribly... terribly alone.

name: Roy
line: Excuse me, I'm sorry to interrupt, uh, I need to see Pam. There seems to be, like, something wrong with the radiator in her car.

name: Michael
line: Okay, fine. Hurry back.

name: Roy
line: There's nothing wrong with your car. I just thought you might like a break from the "grief counseling" session.

name: Pam
line: Oh. I would like a break.

name: Roy
line: How are you likin' the new car?

name: Pam

name: Michael
line: We are. We are. But, I would like you to take notes. And I want you to find out about people's character. Not their hotness, per se, but their humor, and their charisma, and the indefinable quality that makes you all glad to follow me.

name: Michael
line: What happens to a company if somebody takes their boss away? I will answer your question with a question. It's like what happens to a chicken when you take its head away. It dies. Unless you find a new head. I need to see which one of these people have the skills to be a chicken head.

name: Pam
line: You want me to write down people's indefinable qualities?

name: Michael
line: I want you to write down everything that people are doing all day. And then type it up, in a way that is helpful. Alright?

name: Michael
line: This way to the partay bus.

name: Kevin
line: And the night got deathly quiet, and his face lost all expression. Said, "If you're gonna play the game, boy, ya gotta learn to play it right." You got to know when to hold 'em, know when to fold 'em, Know when to walk away and know when to run. You never count your money when you're sittin' at the table. There'll be time enough for countin' when the dealin's done.

line: I was thinking about our little leak problem. I was up all lunch thinking about what we should do to this individual. You know what I think we should do? We make 'em come to work, and we work 'em, and we make 'em sit next to all the people they screwed over. And, and we pay 'em but we make 'em feel like they did something really wrong. The one question I have is, do we give them a Christmas bonus? I say yes, it's Christmas, but right after they're back in the thick of it.

line: And my new favorite restaurant sucks... I bought a video camera last year, and I was looking at the tapes, and there were only like twelve minutes that I felt was worth taping the whole year. And most of that was just birds in my condo complex. What is that? ... I miss Holly.

line: Hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey IT guy. Here's the story, champ. None of us have spent a lot of time getting to know you, okay? Why you been telling people you're not on Facebook? People want to be your friend, man! All right? And you. This guy, you're the one who told the press. You wrote an e-mail to the editor. I saw it, and I also saw a QuickTime movie of your little printer fire test on your hard drive. This guy's the snitch, he's the snitch. So that's it, check it out.

line: I, did I sell cheap printers? I do. But if I have to go out there in front of the press and make one of them public apology recalls, I mean, it's all I'll ever be remembered for. Nobody will want to play with my Barbie.
