name: Michael
line: We at Sabre have betrayed the trust that we have built with our customers. We regret our slow response and our lapse in candor and judgment. At this time, we are issuing a full recall of all Sabre GH400 printers. We will not rest until this problem is solved. There will be no questions. Are there any questions?

line: Am I angry that Gabe stole my girlfriend over the summer? No. I've been through anger-management, OK? So right now, I am sitting on a nice beach at Cape Cod, gazing out across the whitecaps. Oh, look, it's a humpback whale. How pretty. He's eating Gabe.

line: Do you think they should have had open auditions for the band Hanson? What if no one named Hanson showed up? That wouldn't even make sense. Or what if they just hired the littlest kid and a 50-year-old guy who was a murderer? Really safe.

Occasionally he will need a little push, and I will do that, and he'll slow down, and I'll push him again. That's the thing with kids, you have to keep pushing. You have to push them until they push you back. And then you push some more. It's all about give and take, but mostly it's about pushing each other.

So to make things simpler for Deangelo, I just, without lying, strongly implied that I'm Kelly's supervisor. It's not even that much of a stretch. She pretty much does whatever I say.

name: Kelly
line: What?

name: Ryan
line: I'm sorry, I'm sorry, I'm sorry...

name: Kelly
line: Why should I pretend that you are my boss?

name: Ryan
line: Because what would you have done in that situation, Kelly? I'll tell you what I would have done for you. I'd lie for you.

name: Kelly
line: Yeah, but you lie all the time. You lie for no reason. Ryan, you just like to lie.

name: Ryan
line: I'd die for you too.

name: Kelly
line: You really would?

name: Ryan
line: Hey, Kelly Kapoor, if I don't have those call logs on my desk, we're just gonna have to evaluate your future at the company!

name: Kelly
line: Sure thing, Mr. Howard.

name: Deangelo
line: Woo. Glad he's not my boss.

name: Ryan
line: You're the best. Thank you.

name: Deangelo
line: You know I have a cousin who cracked the secret formula for a certain popular cola that I shall not name. So I've never had to buy it. True story. I just drink my cousin's.

name: Dwight
line: Congratulations on your one cousin. I have seventy. Each one better than the last.

name: Deangelo
line: You know what... straight up, why don't you like me?

name: Dwight
line: I'm just not a suck-up like everyone else around here. Okay? I do my job well, so why don't you just leave me alone and let me do it. Okay?

name: Deangelo
line: Ohhhh no.

name: Dwight
line: What?

name: Deangelo
line: Okay? I'm gonna win you over.

line: No you're not.

line: No.

line: No.

line: No.

line: No.

line: No.

line: Yes.

name: Dwight
line: No.

line: Yes. Yes-yes-yes-yes-yes yes-yes-yes-yes-yes-yes-yes-yes-yes-yes-yes-yes!

line: Uh oh, this former administrative assistant misspelled "administrative" and "assistant."

line: The winner

line: What's wrong with juggling, Darryl? I'm a big juggler. I actually perform a motivational juggling routine.

line: Seriously?

name: Deangelo
line: Oh yeah. I'd do it for you here, but uh, what would you say this room is, 300 square feet? 320?

line: It's a little cramped. How many square feet out there? 17, 18 hundo?

line: Sorry gang. Thought my juggling stuff was in the trunk of my car. It's not.

line: I gotcha covered, boss. Used to play with the parabolas myself. Got some extra balls! Hey-hey-hey-ho!

name: Deangelo
line: Sorry, I never touch another juggler's instruments. You know, we're all here, I've got the music cued, why don't I just do my routine without the juggling balls? Prepare... to go into the danger zone.

name: Pam
line: Oh wow, you weren't kidding.

name: Deangelo
line: No. Never. Can someone please throw me a fifth ball? If you dare! Incoming! And we're on! Remember, nothing's impossible! Phyllis, where's Phyllis?

line: Here.

line: Do you believe in me, Phyllis?

line: Yeah.

line: Okay.

name: Deangelo
line: Feel that connection? Don't move your head. Please. Thank you. Oh! Big hand for Phyllis! That took a lot of guts! Ho! I'm Deangelo Vickers, thank you so much, hope you learned something.

name: Kevin
line: Didn't drop a single ball!

name: Pam
line: Look. I'm juggling eggs and bowling balls. I'm juggling with one hand. No hands.

line: What could he possibly stand to gain from a fake juggling routine?

name: Pam
line: What could he possibly stand to gain from a real juggling routine? How can you keep defending him?

name: Jim
line: He's good at his job. And I like working for him.

name: Angela
line: Of course you do, Jim. You're a man. Deangelo is a huge sexist.

name: Andy
line: Whoa, whoa, whoa. I think if he was sexist, I'd be able to tell. I took a crapload of women's studies courses at Cornell. And I wrote my own companion piece to the "v*g1n* Monologues" called the "pen1s Apologies." So I know a thing or two.

name: Angela
line: Okay. Then how about I'm the head of the Accounting Department, but he only ever talks to Kevin? What about Pam and Kelly? Also department heads. But has he ever met with you or even asked you to do anything?

name: Andy
line: How could I not see it? You're so right.

name: Pam
line: Why don't you talk to him about it?

name: Jim
line: And say what? "Hey Deangelo, are you shy or just a sexist?"

name: Pam
line: Why don't you just tell him how his actions are being perceived by the women in this office?

name: Jim
line: Mmm-hmm.

name: Andy
line: And if he doesn't listen, then he can kiss his pen1s goodbye. Snip snip. Am I right, girls?

name: Jim
line: Hey, you got a second?

name: Deangelo
line: Yeah, I got tons of time. This job's a joke.

name: Jim
line: I know. Just the guys. Well, maybe that's, uh, part of the problem. I think...so what happened was, I was talking with some of the department heads. Uh, some of the female department heads.

name: Deangelo
line: Uh-oh. Right?

name: Kevin
line: Hot!

name: Jim
line: Maybe there's a vibe out there, with certain members of the office, that you are...a little sexist, or --

name: Jim
line: Whoa. Whoa. Wait.

name: Deangelo
line: Are you serious? Who feels this way?

name: Jim
line: Oh. Like nobody.

name: Jim
line: It was --

line: Was it Pam?

name: Kevin
line: That sounds like Pam. You know how she gets. Deangelo, she can get really bitchy. Kevin...

name: Deangelo
line: Guys. Hold on. Doesn't matter who, okay? I'm just happy that Jim brought it to my attention because honestly, I had - I had no idea.

name: Jim
line: That's awesome.

name: Deangelo
line: Thank you.

name: Kelly
line: Mom, Ryan's taking us out to dinner tonight. No, no, he's not going to stand us up like he did last time. He won't ever stand us up again.

line: So I am the new customer service supervisor.

line: When Deangelo's around.

line: All the time.

name: Deangelo
line: Oh, I'm glad you asked, Jim. Because apparently there's a rumor running around here that I am a sexist. I can't work here effectively if you guys think I'm something that I am not. I am not a sexist. Raise your hand if you have a v*g1n*. Raise your hand if someone you love has a v*g1n*. Yeah, yeah. Okay. Just about everyone. What about Deangelo's hand? Oh wow. He's got 'em both up. Yeah. Uh huh. Yeah, so it bothers me when I hear that there's gossip around here that I treat women lesser than men. Okay? Frankly, we all look a little ridiculous when that happens.

name: Phyllis
line: I'm not a feminist, but I think that the men in this office are being given chances that the women aren't.

name: Deangelo
line: Dwight, what's your take?

name: Dwight
line: What's the argument here? NBA, WNBA. One is a sport, one is a joke. I love sports, I love jokes. Room for all.

name: Deangelo
line: Man, you're smart. Oh, hey! Hi! Hello. Welcome. Uh, everyone, I'd like you to please welcome Jordan Garfield. This is everyone.

line: Hello.

line: So, Jordan, uh, where did you work before? Uh, a law office?

line: No, Anthropology. We don't have this in that size, pretty lame.

line: Yeah.

line: That's like my dream job. How did you even get that job?

line: Well, I umm -

line: You chose this job over that job?

name: Ryan
line: Okay, okay, back to work, Kelly, we have a lot to get done today.

line: Yeah.

name: Deangelo
line: Yup.

name: Pam
line: Wow.

line: No corporate experience whatsoever. I didn't want anyone with any bad habits.

line: Oh yeah, did he text us?

line: Yeah.

line: No!

name: Pam
line: Jim, what are you doing? Get in there. This is not the time to take a stand. At least he likes one of us.

name: Jim
line: He didn't text me.

name: Andy
line: Yes! I'm in.

name: Angela
line: Andy, what are you doing?

name: Andy
line: I'm going in, into the belly of the beast. Gonna infiltrate and change from within. What's up, mancave!

name: Pam
line: Just go in. Just go in, he probably forgot to text you.

line: Internally, for office use where do we get our paper from? Do we go -

line: Okay, I do not want to waste your time, so I will keep this br-r-r-r-r-r-ief. Now, word on the street is, Mercy Hospital, back on the market. Deangelo would like you to put together a sales pitch for next week. Deangelo has also recently learned about the Barnacle Project. Which is a non-profit organization based in Mystic, Connecticut that assists in the scraping of barnacles --

name: Jim
line: So this is my life. Until I win the lottery. Or Pam finally writes that series of young adult books.

name: Pam
line: So one afternoon, while walking home from school, quirky 10th grader Becky Walters finds a wounded Pegasus in the woods. And she becomes...The Horse Flyer.

name: Ryan
line: Hey! Kelly, that's the last time I'm gonna talk to you about your paycheck! Okay? We pay you a fair salary here, and if you're only here for the money, maybe you shouldn't be here at all.

line: No one likes a money grubber.

name: Kelly
line: I'm sorry, Mr. Howard, I apologize for grubbing for money. I can't do this. I can't do this. I'm sorry. I just can't do it. Deangelo, Ryan is not my boss. Okay? Frankly, he hasn't had a real job here in years.

name: Deangelo
line: Ohh.

name: Ryan
line: Oh, that's hilarious, Kelly.

line: No, he's just a big fraud, Deangelo. He's like Rango. He doesn't work here, basically. Just like the way Rango didn't save those animals. It was just a big misunderstanding.

line: Oh, close call! Okay, why don't you just finish this up and leave it on my desk and I will see you at your place around 2 am.

line: Hey! It sounds like you guys are having a lot of fun, but it's really loud, and some of us are trying to work, so do you think you could do it a little more quietly?

line: Yeah, I don't know.

line: Pass. If I wanted to see a pissing contest, I'd lock Mose in the chicken coop.

name: Darryl

name: Jim
line: So as it turns out, unless you're a young child or a prison inmate, you don't need anyone supervising you. People just come in and do their work on their schedule. Imagine that - people like us allowed to sell paper. Unsupervised. And yet, somehow it works. It must be because the stakes are so high.

name: Angela
line: Nine, eight, five...

name: Jim
line: Well, I really appreciate the offer, but I'm just happy the way things are. Okay. Thank you. That was Jo, asking me if I wanted to take over as acting manager while they find a replacement. I told her... I don't want to mess this up, right? There's a consensus, people are happy.

name: Kevin
line: Thank you.

name: Dwight
line: Dwight Schrute. Yes, I would. Thank you. Jordan, gather my things from my desk.

line: Three, zero, zero. Again, zero. Four, six...

line: Wait...

line: Nice.

line: What have you done?

line: Mose... you'll never guess where I am right now.

line: Aaaaahhhhh!

line: God!

line: Can't stay there all day.

line: I'm coming.

line: Do I at least get to go with you in this fantasy?

name: Jim
line: You'd slow me down.

name: Jim
line: Dwight has been acting manager for three months now. No. A week. Just feels like three months. Let's see, we all have to punch in to a time clock, which is very old, very strong, and has a slot about the size of a finger. We were all given new business cards big enough to set us apart from the competition, which is how I learned that our titles are all now Junior Employee. Our lunch breaks are staggered to prevent wasting time. Mine's at 10

name: Pam
line: Stop stalling! Come on.

name: All
line: I pledge allegiance to the flag of the United States of America, and to the republic for which it stands, one nation...

name: All
line: ...indivisible, with liberty and justice for all.

name: Angela
line: Amen.

name: Dwight
line: Excellent. Morning announcements! There's been a problem with some people sharing copier codes. Your copier code is a distinct 21-digit number that is unique to you, and you only, okay? Don't share it. Jo Bennett, our CEO, will be here today for a high-level meeting involving Gabe and myself.

line: Ooh, about what?

name: Dwight
line: That's on a need-to-know basis.

name: Erin
line: I thought I needed to know for your calendar.

name: Dwight
line: General meet-and-greet. So I expect you to be on your best behavior, which means none of you will be insubordinate, nor will you foment insurrection.

line: Gotcha! Why are you late?

name: Dwight
line: All right. You stop me when I reach the diseased area.

line: Oh! Darryl's funny.

line: Hey, Andy?

line: Yeah?

line: Can I talk to you a second about these client memos?

line: Sure. What's going on?

line: Are you still in love with Erin?

name: Andy
line: What?

name: Gabe
line: Because I am. I need to get her back. I can't be alone anymore. Andy, do you like being alone with me right now?

name: Andy
line: No, this is horrifying.

name: Gabe
line: No. I don't like being alone with me either, okay? I have to get her back. Are you still gonna date her?

line: Do you promise that?

line: Yeah, fine, I promise. We'll never date again. Can we go outside now?

name: Dwight
line: Hey, hey, hey, hey. What do you think you're doing? What's this? What's the Fist?

line: Oh, it's just a social club. You know, like the French Revolution, or the Black Panthers, or communism. It's just a club. Guys talking, you know.

name: Dwight
line: You expect me to believe that you're starting a rebellion?

name: Jim
line: Nope. Social club. God, I hate when everybody calls us a rebellion.

name: Dwight
line: Okay, you know what? I would love to join The Fist.

name: Jim
line: And we would love to have you. But not today. Unfortunately, it's a bad day, what with Operation Overthrow and everything, but I have noted it.

name: Kevin
line: One...

name: Andy
line: Pam, I have to show you this video. You're gonna love it. It's Beyonce falling with a fart mixed in.

name: Dwight
line: I will never be happier than I am right now. I will also never be less happy. I will be at my current maximum happiness for the rest of my life. Because I am manager of the Scranton Branch of Dunder Mifflin. Acting Manager.

line: No food now? Someone has to do something about Dwight!

name: Gabe
line: I'm sorry. This can't wait.

line: He's just gonna call back.

name: Gabe
line: Erin, I am in love with you. I don't believe in much, okay? I don't believe in horoscopes. I don't believe in Christmas. Uh, uh, I sure as hell don't believe in God.

name: Erin
line: What?

name: Gabe
line: Or maybe there's a God. I don't know. I mean, it's just not a guy with a long white beard. Or it could be. I mean, it's possible that that is exactly what - what God is. But for all of the disbelief I believe in us. I believe in love. You have made me believe that for all of the hokum out... there... uh, do we not have voicemail?

name: Erin
line: Dwight doesn't trust robots to give us our messages.

name: Gabe
line: Well... it's just... it messes up my rhythm.

name: Erin
line: I'm taking a break from dating. Gabe was a great guy with so many wonderful qualities, but it was a challenge being touched by him.

name: Jim
line: Wow, you've really embraced the whole Bond villain aesthetic.

name: Dwight
line: Ah, Jim, Jim, Jim. The gun is a Beaumont-Adams. Jo collects them. I thought we could have some nice small talk about it. And the piranha's a rescue.

name: Jim
line: And the desk.

name: Dwight
line: The desk is a replica of Uday Hussein's desk. I saw a picture in Newsweek. Listen, I'm a very busy man. Let's get right down to business.

name: Jim
line: Okay.

name: Dwight
line: Jo is coming later today. I cannot have a subordinate trying to make me look stupid. Okay? I need you to promise me that you'll be on your best behavior.

name: Jim
line: I promise...d other people that I would be on my worst behavior. And I gave them my word, so...

name: Dwight
line: Don't make me fire you.

name: Jim
line: You can't fire me. You're acting manager. Not office manager. So you have no firing powers.

name: Dwight
line: Don't make me pre-fire you.

name: Jim
line: You wouldn't dare.

name: Dwight
line: Watch this. You're pre-fired. And when I'm promoted, you'll be full fired.

line: If you get promoted, and if you haven't fallen in love with me by then.

name: Dwight
line: What?

name: Jim
line: If I had thought that there was a real chance that Dwight would be permanent manager, I would have pre-quit. And you might be saying to yourself, "Well that's pretty premature to think," but I always say, it's better to be pre-pre-preprepared.

name: Dwight
line: How you doing, Jordan?

name: Jordan
line: I'm good.

name: Dwight
line: Everyone here thinks that you're a joke. They think that you were hired because of your good looks, which won't last long anyway. As your pale skin and severe bone structure imply, you'll age swiftly and poorly.

name: Dwight
line: Now I want you to find out what people are saying about me, things they don't want me to know abou- Ohh... it's a holster.

line: Yep. Yep, yep, yep. Lookin' good. Ohh... Oh, what a day. What a day.

line: Dwight, no gun, okay? Don't make us call Jo.

line: Okay. All right. Fine. Everyone calm down. Someone get me a banana. Sorry I freaked you guys out - aah!

line: Andy!

line: Aah! Aah! It's so loud!

line: Eeeeeeee... There's like this crazy ringing going on. I can't - eeeeeee... I can't find perfect C.

line: Okay, everyone make a list of what's lost for the insurance. I lost a necklace, a ring, a painting-

Each night, they slept one inch farther apart, until one night, Lydia left. It was about this time she lost herself in imaginary worlds. She had quit the book club, the choir, citing something about their high expectations. Her lips slowly grew together from disuse. Everytime she wanted to act and didn't, another part of her face hardened, until it was stone. And that fevered night, she rushed to the nursery, threw open the door, "Baby, are you okay?" Baby sat up slowly, turned to mother and said, "I'm fine, b!tch, I'm fine."

line: I am not.

name: Pam
line: Um, excuse me. I'm gonna go to the bathroom.

name: Pam
line: At this point, when you're this pregnant, it's kind of like senior spring. The other day I spit my gum out on the carpet.

name: Robert
line: Kevin, you've been quiet. I'm curious to know what your game-changer is.

name: Kevin
line: Well, you know how in the vending machine they have the chocolate chip cookies in the A-1 spot? They do that 'cause they think A-1's the best spot for the best cookie. But the real best spot is D-4. Right? That's where the eyes go. So...

name: Robert
line: Cookies. Cookie placement.

name: Kevin
line: Yeah. But not just the cookies, though. That was just a 'for instance.'

name: Robert
line: Who else agrees with Kevin, that we're wasting facilities, manpower, on our underselling products when we should be pushing our top-performers? There you go. Consensus.

name: Ryan
line: Okay, we are now on a planet where Kevin is the most creative person around, and I am just some good-looking guy.

name: Gabe
line: I just don't understand. It's 1865, victory is ours, I've saved the very soul of our nation, and yet... happiness eludes me. Oh, perhaps a trip to the theater will enliven my spirits.

name: Audience
line: No!

name: Kevin
line: 'Kay, so another thing about oatmeal cookies. Who even wants them? I mean, I've seen Toby eat one, like, once, but other than that... like, forget it.

name: Robert
line: Interesting. So what is Dunder Mifflin's oatmeal cookie? What is the product that no one wants?

name: Stanley
line: how about that two-hole-punch letter? Only the lawyers want that punch at the top and they use legal.

name: Robert
line: That's the oatmeal cookie. Fantastic, Kevin. Fantastic.

name: Kevin
line: Thank you.

name: Jim
line: By the way, did we leave all the food on the bus?

name: Andy
line: Let's talk about food for a second. Food for thought.

name: Jim
line: Yeah, that's what I had for breakfast and I think that's probably why I'm still hungry.

name: Andy
line: Hunger! Hunger for victory! Hunger for honor. Hunger for pride.

name: Darryl
line: Hunger for hamburger.

name: Erin
line: Hunger for chicken chimichangas. Right, Darryl?

name: Darryl
line: That's good.

name: Andy
line: Exactly. Now do you know the Civil War soldiers were hungry for? Pride! Now, each battalion had its own flag and they guarded these flags with their lives. Colonel Harrison Jeffords of the Fourth Michigan Infantry saw his flag being carried away, chased it down with nothing but a sword. Fought tooth and nail at the foot of that flag until he died. He wasn't about to let them have that flag. Pride. Right, guys? I commissioned this flag for Dunder Mifflin. Cost me two hundred dollars.

name: Jim
line: Only two hundred dollars?

name: Andy
line: We are all branches on this tree. And from the tree comes paper. We're all part of a business. But business is war. What's that I hear? Uh, a rebel paper company is coming to take our flag! Wha- what's going on here? Wee-hoo! Come and get it! Who's gonna get the flag? Who's getting it? Whoa! Hey! Ho! Don't look where I am, look where I'm going. Juke right, juke left.

name: Darryl
line: Andy, this is inappropriate. People died here, man.

name: Andy
line: Get the flag! Get the flag! Come on, Big Tuna. What you gonna do about it? We got a flag right here. Wee-hoo!

name: Andy
line: Spangler Springs is a mile this way.

name: Jim
line: Oh wow. So that's two miles if you incorporate the walk back.

name: Andy
line: Its... I mean come on.

name: Phyllis
line: I don't think I should walk anymore. You know all I had for breakfast was oatmeal, yogurt, coffee, orange juice and toast. Two poached eggs. And then half a sandwich on the bus.

name: Andy
line: Alright fine. You know what â€“ I guess this place just hasn't rubbed off on you the way I hoped it would. I'm still going. And I'm not going to ask anymore. I'm not even going to look back. I'm just going to assume that you're with me.

name: Dwight
line: You said you weren't going to look back.

name: Robert
line: And why is Black Rock suddenly the paragon by which all hedge funds must now be compared?

name: Kevin
line: I don't know.

name: Robert
line: Right. I mean you're an accountant. Those bogus prospectuses must drive you insane.

name: Kevin
line: Yes. I am an accountant.

name: Oscar
line: Dwight â€“ this is one of the archivists here. I thought maybe we could consult him.

name: Dwight
line: Really?

name: Oscar
line: Yeah.

name: Dwight
line: Well. Anyone employed by the Gettysburg Industrial Complex is certainly going to want to keep quiet about the Battle of Schrute Farms.

name: Archivist
line: Schrute Farms did you say? That is a fascinating little chapter of the Civil War.

name: Oscar
line: You've heard about it?

name: Dwight
line: YES! Ha! Prepare to be refuted! Go on.

name: Archivist
line: There you go.

name: Narrator
line: Families and sweethearts back home waited desperately for letters from the front.

name: Soldier
line: Dearest mother I'm sorry it has been so long since my last letter. It is three months since I arrived at Schrute Farms and I fear I may never leave this place alive. Melvin Fifer Garris.

name: Dwight
line: Hallowed ground.

name: Narrator
line: But the Battle at Schrute Farms was no battle at all. It was a code used by pacifists from both North and South who turned the Pennsylvania farmhouse into an artistic community and a refuge from the war.

name: Amanda
line: You have to understand. Poets, artists, dancers â€“ these kind of men preferred peace to war. These delicate lovely men found a place of refuge among the Schrutes at Schrute Farms. Amidst the macho brutality of war this was a place where dandies and dreamers could put on plays and sing tender ballads and dance in the moonlight. I like to think of Schrute Farms as the Underground Railroad for the sensitive... and well... fabulous.

name: Oscar
line: Wow. This is so much better than the story you made up.

name: Dwight
line: I've seen enough.

name: Oscar
line: You're right. There should be a monument to this.

name: Kevin
line: Never trust a cookie with a woman's name. Pecan Sandy. Lorna Doone. Madeline. They'll just break your heart.

name: Robert
line: Kevin!

name: Ryan
line: Robert I hate to interrupt. But I would love to pitch you one last idea. I call it the Big Mac idea.

name: Kevin
line: What?!? No!

name: Robert
line: Big Mac idea. That sounds encouraging.

name: Ryan
line: It's really, really good Robert. Let me explain.

name: Kevin
line: No! This is not fair! This is my idea. He's trying to steal it because he's jealous of me.

name: Robert
line: Well what is the idea?

name: Kevin
line: Every time you buy a Big Mac you set one ingredient aside. Then at the end of the week you have a free Big Mac. And you love it even more because you made it with your own hands.

name: Ryan
line: You know what? Now I remember. That was your idea. That is 100 percent your idea.

name: Robert
line: Oh my. It was just actually cookies the whole time?

name: Andy
line: Dammit.

name: Darryl
line: Hey.

name: Andy
line: You guys came. Where's everyone else?

name: Darryl
line: Back at the bus. We were locked out. Phyllis is sitting on the ground eating a dirty sandwich.

name: Andy
line: Yeah I asked the bus driver to lock it because our stuff was in there. I guess he follows orders.

name: Jim
line: Yeah sorry everyone else didn't come. I think they're just tired. With holes in their shoes. And they have dysentery.

name: Andy
line: Even without an audience you're still at it.

name: Jim
line: What are you talking about?

name: Andy
line: Our office has a disease. And it goes by many names. Sarcasm. Snark. Wisecracks. You take things people care about and you make them feel lame about it with your jokes. That's what you did with this trip.

name: Jim
line: Andy â€“ this whole idea of our situation being just like war? It's just not true. We just work at a paper company. And you're our regional manager. And guess what man? You don't have to prove anything. We like you as regional manager. Andy if you don't believe me take a look at what's on my head. I'm wearing a very pink hat. I've been getting weird looks all day because I'm pretty sure "DM does GB" means something kinda sexual. But guess who's wearing them? All of us. Just for you man. That's huge.

name: Andy
line: You don't like the hats?

name: Jim
line: They're terrible.

name: Darryl
line: I hate myself.

name: Andy
line: They just didn't turn out how I wanted. In my head they were cooler, but they do look weird.

name: Andy
line: The world will little note, nor long remember the fight Jim and I had here at Gettysburg and that's good because I was basically wrong. I wanted my team to be, like, this army and I was their general. But I guess it's really more like they're just people who work in an office and I'm their manager. Yeah that's really probably a better analogy now that I think about it.

name: Gabe
line: Abe and Mary are seated watching the show. Oh Mary this is wonderful... Ok Mary stop your scolding. I'll be quiet. I need her like I need a hole in the head! BANG! Ooh

name: Dwight
line: Oh, little help. Wow your hair is really thinning.

name: Susan
line: Answer the question, please.

name: Dwight
line: Standing is proven to be healthier, increases productivity and just looks cooler. Picture someone doing something heroic. Now was he sitting or standing? Not counting FDR.

name: Jim
line: I don't know what you want me to tell you. To be really honest, my wife works here. And I love it. She literally makes me work harder. She makes me smarter. She makes me remember why I'm here. And between us, she's on maternity leave right now, and I would love to leave this room and see her face. I would love it. I don't know how this helps, but it's just what I'm thinking.

name: Dwight
line: Every second you sit there is an hour off your life. Look at all of you. I feel like you're in a suicide cult.

name: Robert
line: All right. Thanks.

name: Creed
line: No. No. No. You're way off on that one.

name: Jim
line: Yes. All right. Great.

line: Oh yeah?

name: Andy

line: Yeah.

name: Andy
line: Andrew Baines Bernard. I love filling these out. Because it's like taking a test, but I know the answers.

name: Dwight
line: What do you want!?!

name: Robert
line: In four seconds my wife is going to be coming through that door. I told her she could work here. Under no circumstances can that be allowed to happen. There you are! Honey how on earth could you miss the elevator?

line: To look good for Val!

name: Andy
line: What was that?

line: Val Kilmer? I don't buy it. That doesn't make any sense. Wow... I figured out your goal. I am going to make you the buffest dude Val Kilmer has ever seen.

name: Jim
line: I don't know. He wasn't talking to me. But if I were you I wouldn't hire his wife.

name: Ryan
line: That's why my foundation â€“ The Dream for a Wish Foundation â€“ is going to put them out of business. They're not going to know what hit them.

name: Robert
line: Everyone. I'd like to introduce my wife Mrs. Robert California. Mrs. California this is everyone.

name: Susan
line: Hello. Oh call me Susan please.

name: Robert
line: Last night at dinner Susan and I were talking about her returning to work. So she's here today to see if there's a good fit. Something tells me it just might work out. This is Andy Bernard the regional manager.

name: Susan
line: Hello nice to meet you.

name: Andy
line: Hey there. It's a pleasure.

line: Andy would you be so kind as to show Susan around the office. Show her the various departments. Find a place where she'll shine.

line: I would love to. But I have to be completely honest with you guys. We're 100 percent staffed up.

name: Robert
line: Andy. Let's see if there's a good fit first. Then we'll talk.

line: Alright.

name: Dwight

name: Dwight
line: Well today's your lucky day. I have opened in this very office building Dwight Schrute's Gym for Muscles. You wanna take a look?

name: Darryl
line: I'll take a look.

name: Dwight
line: Your path from obesity begins right here!

name: Darryl
line: I've been meaning to join a gym. For my health. I used to say I wanted to live long enough to see a black President. I didn't realize how easy that would be. So now I want to live long enough to see a really, really gay President. Or a supermodel President. I want to see all the different kinds of Presidents.

name: Dwight
line: Obese people in my office are a drain on resources. Chairs wear out faster, it takes more Freon to keep them cool, they flush the toilets more often, plus their massive BMs bust the rivets on my pipes. But a gym turns fat into cash.

line: Alright! The DM Express is pulling out.

name: Susan

name: Andy

name: Robert

name: Andy
line: Ok uh next stop on the tour sales. Here we go. Station stop Jim Halpert. Oh boy our resident truth teller. Alright have at it. Let â€˜er rip. What do you hate about this place?

line: Well it's sales. So you have to be able to live in the world of rejection.

line: It's the second easiest job in the world. Being a mom.

line: I love shopping and sales is just the other side of that.

name: Dwight
line: That is true.

name: Andy
line: You know if you joined our sales department you would be working very closely with our department head Mr. Dwight Schrute.

name: Dwight
line: That's me.

line: Dwight why don't you tell Susan about some of your hobbies. Survival skills. Ranking of animals.

name: Dwight

name: Susan
line: Well make that a red wine and I'll tell you my animal rankings.

name: Andy
line: Oh how am I supposed to pull this off?. The entire office is being nice to her than they've ever been to me. What I wouldn't give for one of Phyllis' classic room clearing farts right now.

name: Dwight
line: Ready? What do you think?

name: Darryl
line: Um no. This is not a gym. This is like a scene out of Saw 5.

name: Dwight
line: You haven't even looked around yet. Look. Gravel bucket squat yoke Right? Dedicated phone book ripping station. You ever cut tin before? Five yards in and your forearms will be on fire. Plus I will buy the tin back from you that you cut for two cents a yard. Now let's go over membership. I'm going to need the first month's and the last month's up front. $49 per month. But every third month is $59 a month. But the fourth month is a discount month at $19 per month...

name: Darryl
line: Obviously you know how a gym works. So you know I'm not going to pay money for this. You want people to come to your gym? Make a real gym.

line: Darryl...

line: I was thinking accounting might be a good fit because I really clicked with Oscar and I do have some experience in bookkeeping.

line: I am the CEO and I am telling an employee of mine what to do.

line: Let me beat around the bush for a second. Our chairman of the board has some very strong feelings about-

line: Robert this is very uncomfortable. Obviously there's no place for me here. So thank you for trying. Why don't we just let it go.

name: Robert
line: No. Absolutely not. Andrew there must be something you can do. Think.

line: There are lots of considerations.

line: I would be eternally grateful. It's not a bad thing to have the CEO owe you one.

line: Alright. Well then welcome aboard.

line: No, I don't think we should be trying to make this place seem unpleasant. I think we should let this place just crush her spirit by itself. I mean, it knows what it's doing.

line: I get it. Last time I had a job, I remember I hated the boss' wife. Of course, she was married to Robert.

line: Andy! Andy, could you step in here, please? We'll fix this.

line: Andy and I had a great conversation. And I just want to let you know that I am not going to be working here.

line: I am meeting Dr. J today, otherwise known as Julius Irving, famed 76er and my own personal hero. But i have to be careful not to rub it in Pam's face because let's be honest, how would I feel if I was at home stuck with the kids while she was go carting with John Stamos.

You look like a baby who suddenly aged 50 years. A cute baby, but something sucked the life force out of it. I'm so sorry. We need mayonnaise! We need it now.

name: Nellie
line: No. No, that is not all. Let me tell you what real life is like. The men dry up, and the nights get lonely. The only calls on your machine are for collection agencies about that pair of motorcycle boots you never even wore. You stalk your old high school boyfriend online, go to his daughter's soccer games, and make a scene. You buy a diamond ring for yourself, wear it on your right hand, and tell yourself, you're all you need. One day, you're alone, tired. At your feet, a dying bird. But where did it come from? Why did you kill it? Is it because in some strange way it is you?

line: Stone and Son Suit Warehouse recently lost their paper provider. They're a family owned business. Jim and I used to clean up at those. We'd go in pretending to be family â€“ brothers. We did it at a family owned law firm, at a family owned construction company, and a family owned motorcycle store. Jim and Dwight Shrupert. I was the dynamic, likeable winner that was doted upon by Mom. And Jim was the closeted foot fetishist pretending to belong. The client never knew any of that, but I knew.

name: Dwight
line: In the past year, I have consolidated the entire Scranton paper market. We regained the white pages, the school district, Lackawanna county. We supply them all. name: Dwight
line: Do I get along with my co-workers? Well, first of all, I don't have co-workers anymore, I have subordinates. So... have I gotten along with my subordinates? Let's see. Angela Schrute, my former accountant is now my wife. My top salesman, Jim Halpert was best man at my wedding and office administrator Pamela Beesley Halpert is my best friend. So...yes. I'd say I have gotten along with my subordinates.
